author: {'steamid': '76561197962897033', 'num_games_owned': 767, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 624, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 624, 'playtime_at_review': 624, 'last_played': 1712432698}
review:
What a fun game with a friend. Brought me back to when I was a kid watching cartoons on Saturday morning. Well worth the price and plays great with a coop partner. 

The maps are re-used but that's ok since you can get through them easy and find all the gold since you already explored. 

If you like "cartoons" play this game with a friend.

author: {'steamid': '76561197990486678', 'num_games_owned': 715, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 414, 'playtime_at_review': 604, 'last_played': 1712454279}
review:
I really enjoy the theme.

Its a solid entry into the burgeoning Co-op FPS rouge-like genre. Though with the progression system its almost more of a replayabe focused Action RPG than a true rouge-like. Which is can be a welcome change for players wanting more long term goals.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966385727', 'num_games_owned': 997, 'num_reviews': 288, 'playtime_forever': 445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 445, 'playtime_at_review': 445, 'last_played': 1712184232}
review:
Received as a gift.

Took 7.4 hours to beat the campaign once in 3 player coop, that includes 2 game overs from bad runs due to bad RNG with perks+enchantments.

I'd say it's a 7/10 right now, definitely better than it was when they first released the demo but definitely could still use some work.  Not a lot of variety in rooms and you see the same ones repeated in all dungeon types (there are 3 episodes per dungeon type and 9 episodes total, so 3 dungeon types total).

Would be nice if you could choose not to have an off weapon, getting perks for the weapon you don't use, even on reroll (you get 4 rerolls per level) is a real bummer.  My 2 coop partners were both the sorceress, both were doing pure spellcasting and they would routinely get 3 perks for melee only, then spend one of their rerolls and get 3 melee perks again.  Seriously needs to be fixed.

Has a FoV slider, I maxed it out, at the start of each level you have to attack once for it to apply your FoV if it isn't default.  If there is headbob I didn't notice, I am really sensitive to both headbob and FoV so if there was headbob it wasn't enough to make me feel nauseous.

There were sync issues at times (like one player would hit an enemy and the enemy wouldn't take damage).

Allies can block projectiles, ie. a sorc casts a spell it hits their ally it doesn't go through them to the enemy.

There are higher difficulties to play on and achievements for grinding through them.  Will see what we do from here.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052125808', 'num_games_owned': 1125, 'num_reviews': 234, 'playtime_forever': 477, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 467, 'last_played': 1710700472}
review:
MythForce hat ein echt geiles Konzept: Wir spielen die komplette Staffel eines 80er-Cartoons und jedes Level ist eine Folge der Serie. Der Stil ist großartig umgesetzt, der Titelsong ein Ohrwurm und die Charaktere sind genauso schmalzig wie ich sie in Erinnerung habe. An der Präsentation kann ich überhaupt nichts aussetzen und muss sie in den höchsten Tönen loben. Fantastisch!

Aber leider ... hauts auf der Gameplayebene nicht so richtig hin. MythForce ist nämlich ein echt eintöniges Roguelite. Wir stampfen durch die zufällig generierten Levels, deren Räume sich schnell wiederholen, und hauen mehrere Monsterwellen um, die in einer Zahl von jeweils 3-5 auf uns zugestapft kommen und ihre Waffe schwingen. Dabei nutzen wir Skills mit viel zu langen Cooldowns oder verlassen uns auf unsere Nah/Fernkampfwaffen. Ich bin über das ganze Spiel gut damit gefahren, die Skills komplett zu ignorieren und mich auf den Powerangriff zu konzentrieren. Der haut den Gegner aus den Socken und sorgt dafür, dass Folgetreffer immer kritisch sind. Dadurch war das ganze Spiel dann relativ leicht. Mit den Perks, die man nach jedem Raum auswählen kann, kann man den Powerangriff noch weiter stärken, bis irgendwann alles nach ein, zwei Schlägen umgekippt ist. Das Powerscaling ist also relativ hoch. Verteidigungsstärkende Buffs habe ich liegen lassen, nachdem ich gemerkt habe, dass die so gut wie nix bringen - wenn mir die Gegner eine zimmern, dann ordentlich - da ist die Lebensleiste entweder halb leer oder ich gehe direkt über den Jordan. 

Auch der Content ist etwas dünn, denn die 9 Episoden dauern pro Durchlauf etwa 30-60 Minuten, je nachdem wie viel Zeit man sich nimmt. Damit flimmert der Abspann schnell über den Bildschirm und der Wiederspielwert besteht darin, die mythischen Schwierigkeitsgrade anzugehen oder einen neuen Charakter auszuprobieren. Das finde ich etwas mau.

MythForce hat mir trotzdem Spaß bereitet. Der Stil fetzt, mir hat diese kitschige Handlung gefallen und der Soundtrack kracht. Im Angebot gerne einstecken, für ein paar Stunden macht das Spiel richtig Spaß!

author: {'steamid': '76561198070674576', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 992, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 992, 'last_played': 1708125228}

author: {'steamid': '76561198169012276', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 1372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1347, 'last_played': 1709252600}
review:
Recomendo somente com 75% de desconto e se você está procurando apenas um fim de semana/algumas horas de entretenimento por esse preço, então talvez possa valer a pena.
Mas não pelo preço cheio, pois existem jogos mais desenvolvidos, parecidos e na mesma faixa, como Vermintide 2.

Conceito e arte incríveis, mas a execução poderia ter sido melhor.

Combate é muito simples e a IA carece de táticas básicas.
Mapas poderiam ter muito mais variedade, fica bem repetitivo.
Progressão é superficial, 90% dela são apenas mais números em vez de novas habilidades e equipamentos.
Dificuldade são apenas os velhos inimigos esponja e mais dano. Tem modificadores, mas são novamente apenas números superficiais em vez de novas mecânicas.
História é rasa.

Mas espero que os Devs continuem tendo essa originalidade nos games, só melhorar a execução.


[h1] English review. [/h1]

I recommend it only with a 75% discount, and if you're looking for just a weekend/a few hours of entertainment for that price, then it might be worth it.
But not for the full price, since there are more developed games that are similar and in the same range, like Vermintide 2. 

Awesome concept and art but the execution could have been better. 

Combat is too simple and AI lacks basic tatics.
Maps could have way more variety, it gets pretty repetitive. 
Progression is superficial, 90% of it is just more numbers instead of new skills and equipment.
Diffculty is just the ol' sponge enemies and more damage. it has modifiers but are again just superficial numbers instead of new mechanics.
Story is shallow.

But i do hope the Devs keep on having this orginality for games, just have to improve it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000606980', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1700973943}

author: {'steamid': '76561197962138742', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2080, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 71, 'playtime_at_review': 2080, 'last_played': 1712429815}
review:
[h1]Loveletter to 80s Cartoons[/h1]
Absolutely gorgeous visuals and sounds. Tell me you grew up in the 80s and dont get a big fat smile when you see beastor for the first time. Well, at least i did... The developers did a great job capturing the look and feel of these shows.

Sadly, the game is a hidden gem. Maybe its because people think its Online only? It isnt. To be honest, this thought was pushing me away at first, but i was so wrong. You can play the whole game solo. Its even perfect to play a round or two after work (Stages last from 30 Minutes to 1 Hour). And if you want to play with your buddys you can, but you absolutely dont need to. 

[strike]Some minor issue i noticed, are the repeating rooms. This gets annoying, because it destroys the illusion of progression when you visit a room twice or at larger stages even 3 times. Maybe this will be refined with a patch?[/strike]

In short, its a fantastic relaxing game with a great synth soundtrack, charming characters, nice graphics and sound. Give it a try

Update:
They did it. They released an upgrade patch. And what a patch it is. Less repeating rooms, faster gameplay, new intro and outro movies(!) for stages. To much to list it all here, but nearly all community complaints were ironed out. And the best of all... for free. This is something special in this day and age.  It shows the developer team really cares for their game. Thanks a lot for many more evenings with mythforce.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023583430', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 137, 'last_played': 1705965358}
review:
The core concept is awesome, but the game needs updates. Coming from Gunfire Reborn and Roboquest, Mythforce feels somewhat floppy, unfinished.

The good points :
- Roguelike mechanics are okay. Weapon and power upgrades are cool enough.
- The core concept, artstyle and *dat opening theme*.

The bad :
- Most inspiration went into the core concept.
- Most secondary equipment feels rather ~meh.
- Arena design : some are okay, some are ~meh in relation to the enemy spawning points.
- Why is eeeeveeeryyyyythiiiing sooooo sloooooooooooow......... From the ridiculous cooldowns to the enemy walking speed (those skeletons feel like slow zombies...), the animations or even basic attacks, Mythforce is too slowly paced for a co-op action roguelike.

    The trailer promising on exciting adventures and legions of baddies delivers trotting around like a tourist in rather empty arenas -which somewhat still feel cramped- fighting a couple skeletons. I rather expected to be chased by a giant boulder in an infinite stairway to some mid-boss fight while jumpdashing, wallrunning and slashing through an army of cannon fodder, all that before the countdown to some evil moon-laser attack gets to zero and the planet is destroyed, you know ? Something epic to play with friends.

Those heroes don't feel heroic. Those adventures don't feel adventurous. It's a prudely paced trot with friends who'll ditch you to play helldivers 2.

But Mythforce can get updates.

Thumb up for updates.

If you're new to this type of games, go to Gunfire Reborn and Roboquest first.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989988274', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 672, 'last_played': 1708038588}

author: {'steamid': '76561198154840872', 'num_games_owned': 447, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1707171019}
review:
More of a neutral review, but given the full price, it isn't worth that.

The theme and art style are executed very well - but that's about it..

I beat the first 2 levels, so I'm not sure if I explored all the systems or not fully but there's not much making me want to yet..

The combat feels unresponsive, you'll hit things and there's almost no feedback (until toward the end of a run when you're decked out, but..)
Levels are over just as you feel you're getting somewhere, I almost feel like they should go for something more like gunfire reborn.
And then there just doesn't feel like there's much of anything.. Rooms in a level repeat a lot, you'll see the same few upgrades and items and each character's 4 abilities are very basic and can't be customised/upgraded much at all.

I'd understand if this was early access, but it isn't.
I'm aware the dev's did update the combat once already (I shudder to think how bad it was before) so I'll keep an eye out for further updates but doubt I'll touch this again until then.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985718899', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1706990372}
review:
Nice casual coop game with some simple yet interesting character progression mechanic. Quite short though: First co-op playthrough took 6 hours to complete, but there are 4 classes and some different builds to figure out. As long as you do not expect a AAA-title you will probably have a fun time with friends. There are some minor multiplayer replication issues (e.g. Victoria's split arrows do not replicate correctly on client side), but all in all the experience was top notch stable and fluent: No crash and no connection loss in any coop run. I mention this, because I read some other player's reviews about "bad servers" of this game, which just makes no sense: It appears to be a peer-to peer-hosting system using EOS, so there should be no connection problems unless the players themself have a bad internet connection. 
I recommend to play coop on hard to unlock the next difficulties.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977041350', 'num_games_owned': 397, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1706990378}
review: Ein großartiges Spiel für einen Zockerabend mit bis zu 4 Freunden. Das Design ist meiner Meinung nach sehr elegant umgesetzt und versetzt einen sofort zurück in die 80er Jahre.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986161082', 'num_games_owned': 430, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1707922884}
review:
Love the graphics. But the gameplay is bad. For example, I am playing solo, I back into an alcove with walls only, no black doorways, and STILL monsters just appear right behind me. It would be one thing if it was a monster with teleport, but these are skeletons. 

So for the fun 80s style graphics, yes. But for gameplay, which is more important, no, I cannot recommend this. If you want to make the game more challenging, make better AI, make the monsters faster, etc. But just forcing spawns on top of you right behind you is simply poor design. It will bore and frustrate you before you even finish.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017321912', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 167, 'playtime_forever': 2519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2519, 'last_played': 1706653177}
review:
As someone have said already: I wanted to like this game, but I just can't.

The core idea behind the game is good - a co-op adventure, made to feel like it's just an another episode of the 80's cartoon show. Visuals are great and it does indeed look like an 80's cartoon. NGL - that distinct look was exactly the thing that sold this game to me.

Unfortunately, behind a cute picture hides a "not so cute" gameplay. At the 2 hour mark I already knew that the game wasn't good and I was deliberating if I should refund it or not. In the end I've decided to give it a bit more time and explore it more thoroughly and 42 hours later I think that I should have refunded it back than after all. Now I will explain the game's problems, so that you can avoid my mistake.

1. Playerbase and connectivity issues. This game was designed as a co-op game first and foremost. But unless you have a few friends from the same town willing to play the game together with you - you better forget about the "co-op" part alltogether. First - the playerbase is low and you will be quite lucky if the game matches you with someone else at all. Second - even if it does, there are no dedicated servers, the game is hosted on a player's PC and the netcode is terribad. Every, EVERY SINGLE FKIN TIME that I was connected to someone else, or someone else was connected to me - the ping suddenly decided that using Mars as a reroute point is an excellent idea. And I'm not talking about a 0,3 second delay that is enough to drive crazy most modern gamers. The games goes a full on unresponsive mode with teleporting mobs, 5-10 second delays, invulnerability issues and so on and so forth. Every single fkkin time. It's literally unplayable. After trying for about 20 times at different time with different people - I've just gave up on the "co-op" idea and simply played solo. And just one more thing - there is no host browser window. You can't choose your region or a game's map that you want to play. Thre is only a "join a game" button and the will of the RNGesus.

2. Basic gameplay. Many players complain that the game is too slow and easy. And indeed beating the maps on the Normal/Hard difficulty is not too hard at all. Mobs are slow, they don't hit too hard and are generally easy to beat. The real game starts at the Mythic 1-2-3 levels. But the thing is - most players will never even see them. There are 9 maps in total and every 3rd one has a major (episode) boss and the steam stats say that the first boss was beaten by 31% of players, second by 13% and the last one only by 8%. Is it because they are progressively harder? Not at all - it is because players loose interest in the game that fast, thinking that there is no point in playing it if it's this slow and easy. But the thing is that going from hard to mythic bumps the difficulty by A LOT. Monsters suddenly 2-shot you, they become stronger and their number increases, you need to pray for the good DPS perks and in general be constantly on alert. This is an entirely different game. Personally I think that the Mythic difficulty should have been unlocked right from the start, instead of requiring beating the hard difficulty first - just to show that the game could be a lot more brutal before ppl decide that it's too easy and lose interest in it.

3. Maps and animations. This is a "roguelite" type of a game where levels "change" each run. The thing is - there are simply not enough assets to make levels feel any different. Every single run feels absolutely the same. It gets dull very, VERY quickly. Also the game lacks "funny distractions" like some silly critters running around, moving mechanisms, mysterious spirits floating around, etc, etc. For a good roguelite this is a must to take off players eyes away from the repeating assets. If you constantly bump into the same walls, stairs and 2 coffin models all the time - you get tired of it quick. Another issue that breaks the immersion - poor animations. Some of them are ok, skills are mostly well done, but others... For example there are plenty of chests in game. They literally have 2 frames on em - "closed chest" and "open chest" there is no "opening" animation it just unlocks instantly in 1 frame. When you attack jars with melee weapon, weapon just stops for a second and then jumps to the next frame. It doesn't feel smooth at all. Some people might defend this by saying "it's mimicing an 80's animation style with abrupt cuts" but this is no 80's animation it's 2020's game and to enjoy it players want smooth animations that flow well.

4. Perks, progression, grind.  Every single one defencive perk (aside from vampirism or health restoration) is utterly useless. Especially if you play solo. If you stack up all the defencive perks they will barely reduce the incoming damage, but with inadequate offencive capabilities mobs will steamroll you easy AF. On the other hand if you manage to stack only the best damage-related perks you can critshot even a mythic-level boss with a few good hits and oneshot most other mobs. This is a poor balancing. Next is the progression issue - whatever character you pick up in the beginning - you better stick with it,  because the only thing that transfers between characters - it's the castle (shops) upgrades. But gold and constellation crystals - are separate. And you will need A TON of gold to max up even a single weapon. And without a maxed weapon good luck trying to beat mythic-lvls (not entirely impossible, but way harder than it should be). Most people will drop the game waaaay before they get even a single weapon to the max lvl. Default gold drop amount should definitely be increased by at least x1,5-2 and both gold and crystals should be an account-based asset, not a character-locked.

5. Hitboxes. They are one more issue that makes me enraged. I've lost count how many time did my character got hit and died by a monster swinging a sword like 5 meter away from me. Seriously, lizardmen swings at empty air not even close to your character and boom - you take damage from it. Fkk this. Also this works the other way around too, especially with arrows - many times when you shoot right at the enemy - the arrow just go through it without inflicting any damage. Especially if it's a sceleton.

6. This may be my personal issue - but WTF are those lightning acolytes, devs? The most brutal, unforgiving and cheating enemy of all. They AOE hit waay out of the hit zone (there is no such issue with fire or cold acolytes, only lightning), their direct lightning strikes are instant, unavoidable and hit harder than any other enemy or attack in the whole game. On mythic 2-3 it gets so bad, that i really afraid of them more than any boss, and instantly dump all CD's on 'em if i see one. Don't tell me this BS is by design >_>

So all in all - decent idea, that i would love to support, but poor execution with disfunctional co-op, poor balance, excessive grind, boring level layout, technical hiccups and many other things that may not be critical on their own, but together they snowball into one unpleasant mass - all this make this game an expirience, that i would recommend to avoid.


PS: I think that there is a chance to save this game, but I don't think that the devs are brave enough to take the required drastic measures to actually do that. The game needs to be closed for approx 1,5-2 years and in that time a total rebalance of the gameplay and progression should be done, levels impruved and made fancier, dedicated region-based servers for co-op implemented, etc. But it's a lot of work, that require time and money and with the amount of interest (or to be precise with the complete lack of it) that gamers gave the Mythforce... I think that this game is on a straight path to mists of oblivion atm, so no one will actually try to resque it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985072747', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 436, 'playtime_forever': 598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 598, 'last_played': 1705283856}
review:
For people of a certain vintage, this is a must play. I really enjoyed my 10 hours I put into it, and even had some good co-op partners, although I had to actively look for some of them. 
It looks great with it's 80s cartoon feel. There just needed to be more variety in weapons, upgrades, level design and enemies.
I just think that once you have finished the story, there is little to drawn you back. The upgrade system is there, but nothing special.
I reckon they could make a sequel and get it right.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971765149', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 5538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 3, 'playtime_at_review': 909, 'last_played': 1712014114}
review:
Class design is great, upgrading your characters feels good, and the core gameplay is fun. 
Occasional oddities like getting stuck in the wall, or abilities not able to be used even though they are off cooldown. Enemy spawns can be really frustrating and can end really clean runs in a matter of seconds, but I guess that is part of the learning curve. 

Overall great co-op and I hope it continues to be updated.

author: {'steamid': '76561199127657358', 'num_games_owned': 395, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 255, 'last_played': 1707058228}
review: Great game, it's feels nice to play and has a great 80's texture

author: {'steamid': '76561198151884067', 'num_games_owned': 351, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1408, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1053, 'last_played': 1706691824}
review: Игра хорошая и заслуживает выйти в положительные отзывы. Основные претензии к ней технические, но за все время я не ощутила этих проблем от слова совсем. Играть весело, графика интересная, мотив песни залипает в голове. С друзьями проводить в ней время очень приятно.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046985877', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2800, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 821, 'last_played': 1706210966}
review:
I don't know why so many poor reviews!  This game is good, the most important part of a game is its combat system and this one is a lot of fun A+ combat, the graphics are decent, and the sounds and music is not bad. 

Interesting unique characters with vastly different play styles, different types ranged magic/bow, differnt melee styles 2handed 1 handed and shilds with block and parry mechanics i frame dodging, double jumping, teleportation ect.. and an interesting way to mix and match different pieces togeather.

The items and perks could be better as some are complete duds and some are way OP!  But it doesnt hinder my enjoyment of the game. 

My only complaint,  which can be easily remedied overtime with more development, is the levels are repetitive as the it is a certain number of pre-made levels always the same just in different orders,  sometimes the same level back to back.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970338771', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1696618404}
review: I'll play it again once the loot doesn't put me to sleep and the roguelike choices actually matter.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994597419', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 68, 'playtime_forever': 649, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 548, 'last_played': 1705366185}
review:
One of those "I wish there was a neutral option" reviews.

As a roguelike, this fails hard. 
- There's no between-character progression other than stages and overworld levels. If you don't like your character after farming for 10 hours, guess you have to farm another 10 hours for gems.
- There's no between-stage progression. You start fresh every time, which makes sense because (next)
- Balance is ALL OVER THE PLACE, as many others have mentioned.
- It's nearly impossible to solo on harder difficulties, especially with curses like "if you get hit, lose 10 max hp". Like, WHAT?
- The overarching progression is... not fun? 1. You give items a higher drop chance. 2. You slot gems, which you have to ceaselessly farm (here you have to choose between damage and defenses). 3. You level max perk totals, but you can't delevel them so you can't actually make a consistent build. 4. You upgrade weapons, for incrementally doubling damage.
- If you decide you like a weapon and don't want to use/upgrade the other one, well then you're definitely going to get a bunch of weapon upgrades for the one you're not using! Hah!
- Gold is shared within the map and is tied to overworld progress. If you decide you actually want to use the shop, you lose out on progression. 

As a multiplayer game, it succeeds somewhat. Though, there are caveats. 
- You can give build-specific items to your friends. But, if any ability upgrades drop, it's first come first serve. Chances are you won't even *see* them. 
- If one member is bugged, the run is over. "You must gather your party before venturing forth!"
- Quickplay is fun sometimes, awful at other times. It commonly places you in matches that are nearly over. Most of the time, you don't get any perks. You don't get any starting items. Sometimes it'll place you in a match where the host is AFK, and you CAN NOT join any other games (it'll just keep sending you to that one). Additionally, you'll be placed in a game that is NOT the difficulty you selected.

There are a lot of bugs and QOL problems.
- Hitting skeletons with a bow is damn near impossible to the point that playing the archer is inadvisable.
- There are holes you can fall down and never come back from. You're not dead, but the run is over for everyone in the party.
- Some abilities are 'slippery' in that you might miss if you're slightly off of the hitbox even if your weapon actually hits them.
- General bugs. Sometimes you might use your Mythforce ability and not be able to attack. Other times, there are floating wall textures.
- Enemies will occasionally spawn right on top of you.
- Enemies will get locked behind the black spawning walls (tldr: bad level design) where they can hit you but you can't hit them.

As a massive fan of their BG2 port, I'm kind of disappointed by Beamdog's take on roguelikes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992054913', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1383, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1142, 'last_played': 1705816211}
review:
Ah, this is the best of the "Rogue-lite" games my friend and I have played over the last few months! Without a doubt.

The campaign is more "on rails" than is Roboquest, but the gameplay itself is the most fun we've had with this game style.

You play as one of several "heroes," each one of which has particular built-in perks. Nothing new there. But the various perks are quite intriguing, and, each "hero" has its own in-game dialog that runs and interacts with the other "heroes'" in-game dialog. The net effect is that the game just doesn't take itself seriously, which adds to the fun. 19-hours in, and the running dialog is still entertaining rather than monotonous.

For example, the "Victoria" character hits a trip wire and gets herself all corroded. The "Maggie" character, in a deliciously snarky tone, says, "Victoria, did you not even SEE the trap?" And it goes on and on. Back and forth. So far it hasn't gotten old. It probably will, but then it's just background noise.

The "lite" part of "Rogue-lite" in this game is a very detailed, intuitive, and fun-to-grind tech tree. There is a "constellation" of four-colors of gems that you acquire throughout each run. You can spend "shields" (another in-game drop) to expand the constellation, opening new drop-points for your gems to enhance weapon-power, crit-damage, lucky-shot, various defenses, power-cool-down reductions, and so on. Cleverly, you can get 10 of a particular gem color and then stack them into a single higher-power gem, so you replace a single gem with a stack. And you can combine stacks (in exponential) fashion three more times (if you have time in your life to gain the many hundreds of gems needed and the millions of in-game dollars). It's an intriguing approach that is satisfying to build out.

Of course, you can also level your weapons, which (unlike most such games) this game lets you keep! So, find your preferred weapon combo (you can have a primary and secondary), and then grind to level them.

You can also level "trinkets" for both power and drop-frequency, and you can level perks for power and frequency that are granted at drop-stations between each part of an "episode."

In short, there's LOTS to motivate you to mine for in-game drops and perpetually level your character, weapons, and chances. It's by far the best of the "tech" approaches I've seen in a "Rogue-lite" game.

The story line is about as meh as all of these games. It's a "story" to motivate your pass through a particular run, nothing more. It also motivates some of the running in-game dialog between the characters. Again, meh, but the in-game dialog has enough high-points to be worth having in the game.

The weapons are fun to play and feel right. Again, this is something that many games can't seem to manage to get right, but this one does.

The balancing and difficult scale "correctly" IMO. "Easy" mode is indeed manageable for even your initial low-level, low-tech characters. "Normal" is a for-real challenge, even with a half-leveled character. We haven't even tried harder difficulty-levels yet, because "normal" is plenty enough of a challenge for where we are in the grind path. So, there's a LOT of replayability here.

Co-op works well, with a simple Steam invite. I will say that a couple of times the servers have seemed to have trouble getting us connected, but that's been rare. It IS something you should be aware of, though, because the MOMENT that it becomes more money that it's worth for them to keep the servers up, this game is insta-dead! Remember Loadout, which was great until the moment when it was insta-dead. You are definitely taking a risk with this sort of multiplayer/co-op support. But you'll almost certainly get your money's worth by the time the insta-death happens.

This game gets it all right IMO. It's our go-to game at the moment, and that's saying something, given our limited game-time opportunities.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966688071', 'num_games_owned': 1704, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 566, 'last_played': 1709271417}

author: {'steamid': '76561197977277594', 'num_games_owned': 354, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 764, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 635, 'last_played': 1705431138}
review:
Q. Is this game amazing?                                                        A. ABSOLUTELY
Q. Is this game worth the price?                                             A. ABSOLUTELY
Q. Is this game perfect?                                                          A. Of course NOT, don't be ridiculous!

That out of the way, this game is honestly great! Two thumbs up! It does have it's flaws, of course, but they are in no way game breaking or ruin the enjoyment of the game. However, more polish IS needed. From what I've seen so far, I'm inclined to believe that this game will continue to get better as time goes on. Don't miss out, grab a couple of copies and jump into this with a friend!

DEVS:  Please address Mythic Difficulties, they hardly seem worth it.  Honestly, Hard seemed more worth my time.  And on a side note please add more Character skins. I liked that what you do have is varied, please continue that trend. Or possibly instead, some form of workshop support so WE can create skins? :)
Keep up the great work!

author: {'steamid': '76561198046931452', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 285, 'last_played': 1704911894}
review: Liebe Spielerinnen und Spieler. Der erste Trailer zu diesem Spiel versetzte mich in selten dagewesene Aufregung. Mir war trotzdem vor dem Kauf bewusst, dass es nicht das beste Spiel der Welt sein wird. Die Sounds sind toll. Quasi originell und erinnern an 80s Cartoons wie He-Man. Das Gameplay ist einfach und doch schlecht gehalten. Es ist klobig und fuehlt sich an als wuerde ich ein billig PS2 Spiel Rip-Off aus Korea spielen. Es ist langsam und die Gegner bewegen sich oft auf der Stelle und spielt man mit dem Bogen, braucht man garnicht mehr nachzudenken. Die Idee hatte grosses Potential und nach ca. 5h Spielzeit, verzichte ich fuer den Rest meines Lebens darauf dieses Spiel zu starten. Ich danke den Machern dafuer meine Zeit so ausgiebig verschwendet zu haben. Ueberlegt doch mal ein Kartenspiel rauszubringen, dafuer brauch man keinerlei Talent. Liebe Gruesse

author: {'steamid': '76561198054442582', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 354, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1707800434}

author: {'steamid': '76561197969250301', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 692, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1705710758}
review:
An absolute joy. Not a hardcore game by any means, but that isn't what it is trying to be. The nostalgia is absolutely pitch perfect, down to every approved for Saturday morning tv joke. The art style is cheerful, and it is a wonderful rogue lite to pass the time with friends with. Cannot recommend this enough

Also love all the 80s cartoon eastereggs

author: {'steamid': '76561198044328251', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3006, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2903, 'last_played': 1706287490}

author: {'steamid': '76561198018465814', 'num_games_owned': 970, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1706261620}
review:
All the mechanics are here, and it looks beautiful. But every finishing touch is missing, every sound effect a placeholder. It's secretly still early access/shoved out the door unfinished by the publisher, and it may not get better. But it really hits some of the high notes that Vermintide does, especially in co-op.

EDIT2-24 No updates on the horizon, and what's here isn't enough. Changed to thumb down.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044078240', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 264, 'last_played': 1704402895}
review: Catchy game that is easy to pick up and put down, or to power through depending on your time commitment. The levelling is done well enough that you never feel under-powered even if you haven't played for a while. Improvements keep coming, and the gameplay keeps flowing. If you played at launch and haven't since then, check out how far it's come.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993009914', 'num_games_owned': 768, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 868, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 424, 'last_played': 1706737778}
review: Great music, fun art style and chill combat. More fun with friends!

author: {'steamid': '76561198040368014', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 550, 'last_played': 1706239359}
review: I love this game. My buddy and I started playing it on the PS5, and then we switched over to PC recently. It really does look like those old 80's and 90's cartoons I grew up with, which is awesome. The music is fantastic, the combat is great and I love how they give you a reason to actually keep playing. The upgrade system is definitely designed to give you the ability to keep playing the game for a good while.

author: {'steamid': '76561198072714967', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 215, 'last_played': 1705255643}
review:
Игра хорошая, советую к покупке, особенно если есть возможность поиграть с другом, хорошая боевка, графика нормальная свой какой-то ностальгический стиль по мультикам 80-90ых, но к сожалению игра не без проблем

Проблемы:
Мало персонажей и разнообразия, рога и лучник очень похожи друг на друга, даже одинаковый базовый набор оружия. 

Ульта у персонажей  либо непонятная, либо бесполезная, честно сказать не нашел где прочесть, но чем ульта лучника от роги и война отличается, вообще загадка, хотелось бы конечно что-то эпичное, сложно это требовать от игры за 9 баксов, но все же.

Баги, но не критичные, но все же неприятные, во-первых, постоянно "заедают" способности, иконка позволяет использовать, но почему-то не прожимается, очень раздражает это даже меня убило у босса, не мог убежать от него, а способность передвижения не прожималась, но благо играл не один поэтому жопа не сильно сгорела, во-вторых появление мобов, проваливание за текстуры, всё здесь, пару раз лут проваливался сквозь землю.

Типовые комнаты, на первых 3ех часах игры не раздражало, но вот когда попадаешь в катакомбы и приходится постоянно бегать по одним и тем же типовым комнатам это начинает раздражать.

Итог: пока могу сказать, что ценник игры 500 рублей и надо играть с другом чтобы использовать весь потанцевал игры, потому что если играть в соло, то есть куча рогаликов, которые дадут прикурить этой игре в плане механик, сюжета и вылизонности.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026918301', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 644, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 248, 'last_played': 1705529253}
review:
If you like the art style and 80s cartoon vibes, you'll likely have a lot of fun.

It can be a bit more repetitive than your standard rogue-lite game play loop, but I imagine that will continually improve with updates. There's 3 difficulties beyond hard with increased drop rates on game resources, and there's 4 characters- so the replay value is already pretty high. Co-op is significantly more fun than solo, but I enjoyed the hour or so I put in solo.

The mixed reviews seem pretty unfair, honestly. The devs appear active and the game is already really well worth grabbing on sale. It seems like a solid investment in a cool dev team/game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998889044', 'num_games_owned': 784, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1056, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1052, 'last_played': 1704809396}
review:
I love this game so much! Give this game another chance if you already fell off it. I played this game early on and did not enjoy the combat or the progression. After the updates they have made I really love this game. The progression is interesting and fun. The combat is awesome. I have been playing with my kids. One of them throws down a shield as a wizard as we lob out ranged attacks until the enemies approach us. Then we break out the swords. We just beat the game together on easy tonight. Easy enough for the family to play together. Challenging enough to where we now want to explore some of the higher difficulty settings for more rewards! 

I highly recommend this game. I hope they add some DLC. I would love to see what else the developers could come up with.

review: Fun roguelike game with awesome 80s cartoons inspired graphics. It get's boring playing solo, might want to give it a try if you have a friend to play it with.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006636546', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 125, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1704773423}
review:
First impressions:

I like the game and the aesthetic. It seems like it has a solid foundation with a strong nostalgia factor. It's simple and intuitive and charming.

The menus are a bit bare bones, and the tutorial should be interactive. (example: I want to buy a tome of lightning I need an armory lvl 2 or something... I'm not sure how how I got an armory level 1...)

I don't normally advocate DLC, but adding characters would probably bring in what I believe is much needed development cash to polish the experience.

It's worth noting that while I have Epic games installed, the game needed more software from epic games, which didn't quite seem right to me. I bought it on steam, so the necessary files should come from steam.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004306150', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 8621, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 670, 'playtime_at_review': 8519, 'last_played': 1712350508}
review:
This game released at least a year early.  Possibly more.  But that's the entire industry these days.

I had my complaints in the past, but enough of them have been addressed that I feel I should flip my recommendation.  This game exists in a weird border between good and bad that I can't properly put into words, but there something here I think more people should see.

Playing on easy for the spectacle is recommended, and having a friend to play it with is even more recommended.  There is a late game challenge to be had, but I do not recommend grinding solo.  Soloing the hard content is where the fun dies, and that's most of my playtime.  Play the easy parts for the spectacle and when you stop having fun stop playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999331808', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1694621565}
review: When I first played Mythforce I was blown away by how much it both looked, and felt, exactly like an unfinished indie game. However, its clear the devs put in tonnes of hard work in the years since I first tried it; now, it looks and feels exactly like an unfinished indie game, only somehow worse?

author: {'steamid': '76561197965374160', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 231, 'last_played': 1704259303}
review:
The style, music, dialog are amazing! Had some gameplay issues at launch, movement was too slow and attack/block was a bit slow and couldn't be interrupted. They fixed those issues in recent update, can now interrupt attacks to block/dodge, animations and movement are faster, can clip end of an animation to start another attack.

Really enjoying the game now, just need to play some co-op with friends, I have a feeling that will be even better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121340436', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 908, 'last_played': 1702864912}
review:
Fun game, lots of replayability. Most of the issues that people have listed for this game have been resolved or are in the process of being resolved. It does seem like a lot of the negative reviews are overly harsh considering the light nature of some of the issues - caveat being that there do often seem so be issues with connecting to a game where the host has terrible connection and this can greatly impact quality of game play. Overall this occurs infrequently it if you end up matched into a game like this you can just dip out and find another quick play to join. Most fun when playing with friends of when you end up finding a good group to tear through levels with. 

Game play feels great. Each character and move set are a lot of fun. The animation and art style are interesting and have a retro feel without being tacky or taking away from the ambiance. Overall I'd say it's worth it. Would love to see more content / character customization added in the future, to keep each character feeling unique and keep it feeling fresh.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960677714', 'num_games_owned': 2155, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1703558974}
review:
Leider eine Nullnummer in schönem Gewand.
Der Style und die Musik von MythForce sind wirklich super aber leider hilft das nix, wenn sich der Kampf einfach nicht rund anfühlt, nach dem ersten Akt sich alles wiederholt und man für kleinste Upgrades ewig lang grinden muss.

Zu 50% hat man das Gefühl, dass man am Gegner vorbei schlägt, sprintet, blockt und schießt was super frustrierend wird mit steigendem Schwierigkeitsgrad.
Die "Upgrades" und "Level" etc. spürt man in der Regel kaum bis gar nicht (z.B. 5% erhöhter Kritschaden...Chance wäre ja ok aber paar Prozent mehr KRITSCHADEN? Das merkt man halt NULL!) oder nur in den seltensten Fällen was absolut liegen gebliebenes Potential ist.
Die Missionen welche dem Spieler Geld für Upgrades geben sollen bekommt man nicht pro Charakter sondern insgesamt was bedeutet wenn man einen Char levelt fehlt es für die anderen an Kohle die man dann nur durch abgrundlangweiliges Grinden hochgezogen bekommt.

Desweiteren ist das Game quasi tot.
Wenn ihr also keine Leute habt die das Spiel mit euch zusammen spielen würden dann könnt ihr nur Solo rumrennen was zu vielen Toden führt die meist durch Pech entstehen (z.B. Bugs wie "Man kann nicht mehr angreifen und muss dann aufgeben" oder weil 8 Elitegegner in einem engen Korridor um dich rum spawnen)

Keine Ahnung...für kleines Geld unter 10€ könnt ihr euch das mit ein paar Freunden holen und ein Wochenende etwas Spaß damit haben aber mehr ist hier leider nicht zu machen. :-/

author: {'steamid': '76561198134316237', 'num_games_owned': 373, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 2068, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1045, 'last_played': 1703988082}
review:
Visualmente hermoso, la estética ochentera le sienta muy bien. De verdad pareces estar inmerso en una serie animada. 
Buena banda sonora, y el estudio detrás es Beamdog (Los Baldur’s Gate clásicos).

Es un roguelike (Parecido a Gunfire Reborn) con un poco de exploración de mazmorras que puedes jugar tanto en solitario como en cooperativo. 

Recomendado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198872187586', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1009, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1009, 'last_played': 1649789697}
review: Mythforce offers a thrilling gaming experience with its captivating animations and engaging gameplay. The vibrant visuals bring old school cartoon vibes to dungeon slaying. The fluid animations enhance the overall immersion, creating a seamless and enjoyable gaming adventure. Cannot recommend this game enough.

author: {'steamid': '76561199119529542', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 3739, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2123, 'last_played': 1704144542}
review: Ein sehr gutes Spiel. Unbedingte Kaufempfehlung für Roguelike Shooter Fans. Das Spiel ist genauso gut und auch von der Spielmechanik vergleichbar wie z.B. die ebenfalls aus diesem Jahr stammenden sehr guten Spiele Arcadegeddon oder Superior: Vengeance. Der Unterschied zu diesen ist, dass bei Mythforce beim Spieler tatsächlich der Eindruck entsteht, man spiele in einem Comic aus den 80gern - wie beworben. Und ich fürchte, dass dies die Ursache für die relativen schlechten Reviews ist. Optisch wirkt es veraltet, und das in jeder Hinsicht (Level-Design, Menüführung, Aussehen der Spieler und Gegner, Upgrade System etc.). Ich selbst finde das raffiniert gemacht, denn es ist letztlich in aktueller Technik entwickelt. Hinzu kommt vielleicht für die durchwachsende Kritik eine m.E. nicht so gute Erklärung der Spielmechaniken, so dass man doch länger braucht, um alles zu entdecken, was in dem Spiel steckt. Es hat auch immer noch einige Bugs (obwohl es ja kein EA ist), auch wenn es nach dem letzten Update besser geworden ist. Ebenfalls wie bei den anderen beiden genannten Spielen: Das Hochleveln des Charakters ist notwendig, um auf höheren Schwierigkeitsgraden zu bestehen, dauert aber ewig. Nur Liebhaber haben diese Ausdauer. Und es gibt nicht allzu viele Level/Missionen, auch wenn diese jedes Mal leicht verändert werden. Doch an meiner gespielten Zeit sieht man: Es kann wirklich lange unterhalten und man sollte nicht zu früh ein negatives Urteil fällen. Mir macht es Spaß. Ich habe es nur im Single-Player gespielt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198818419214', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 691, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 28, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1712327924}
review:
Looks nice but is SO SLOW.... it's like you're playing in slow mo... like at 25% move speed the rate of L4D2 or Vermintide 2... You move slow, attack slow and this is apparently after the update to make things faster? yikes how slow was it before?

Level design is also pretty ugly... rooms make no sense and have no flow..

Just played a bit more to give it a another chance, learned you can sprint with Shift. feel like this should be the default move speed or close to it..

Also.. only 27% on players have even beaten the first Boss in stage 3.. of 9 total stages..

author: {'steamid': '76561198020398624', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 817, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 789, 'last_played': 1703186861}
review:
The game is honestly close to good, but there are numerous issues, some would be easy to address, others would require some time from devs. Nothing that is truly requiring a full rework from the ground up, but tiny things that gnaw away at the enjoyment of the game. Off the top of my head:

Perk/Enchant balance is all over the place. Perks vary from incredibly helpful to completely useless or detrimental to a surprising degree. Defensive perks are incredibly weak compared to the damage that enemies do, and offensive perks scale so quickly that they outpace enemy health hilariously fast.

Hit reg: The only things that hit you in this game are because of their absurdly misrepresented hitboxes, and Caster mobs that teleport on top of you and throw a huge AoE suddenly. This wouldn't be so frustrating if these attacks didn't empty 60% of your health bar in one hit, but as I mentioned earlier, building defensively in this game is simply too weak compared to enemy damage.

Missions: Why is the method for unlocking the next difficulty of a mission to beat it on the lower difficulty, instead of beating the previous level on the given difficulty? Why do perks/enchants scale so high in level when the chapters end so quickly that you have no time to level them up? Why are perks/enchants not weighted towards helping upgrade ones you already have instead of offering every perk at equal %?

Voicelines: Love the voice acting, hate hearing a character point out the exit door 3 times in 5 seconds. 

The game is riddled with tiny design choices that just make you wonder why? The game is like... 90% playable, but that last 10% really detracts from how much fun this game COULD be if it was really cared about. You can tell there is a lot of love that went into this game, but it feels like when it came time to clean it up and ship it out, someone else came in and said there wasn't time to do any of that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045923632', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 13, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1712289746}

author: {'steamid': '76561198057009655', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1703120180}
review: Like others, I really want to recommend this game. However, I cannot. The game just doesn't feel right - it's entirely too janky.  Combat feels sluggish, enemy attacks are poorly telegraphed. Distance on attacks from both the player and enemies feels off.  I don't take issue with the progression, skills, upgrades and such. Though I feel these are lacking, it would not be enough for me to write a negative review. The game play I just cannot overlook. The unfortunate part is that these core game play elements are deeply rooted and hard to fix, so I'm concerned this may never be remedied.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968053962', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1694564893}

author: {'steamid': '76561199529746296', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1703020798}
review:
Made by people in their 40s, for people in their 40s.

Honestly please read this and more reviews before buying, I fell for the recent reviews. "Oh it was mixed but now its positive and the positive reviews seem to be fine, maybe people were just picky early on!"

I cannot believe BEAMDOG, the people responsible for the Baldur's Gate remasters, are behind this one. Or maybe I can? They had a shitty reputation from doing those remasters. And you know what if you look at their catalog of games, they dont have any that ARENT remasters of old dnd games or ports of board games. This is basically their first forray into the game making space, and it really shows. Not to mention they laid off 26 of their staff on Sept 19th, a week after this game "released".

This game's entire marketing gimmick is that its reminicent of 80s cartoons. But it also plays like its for someone who's not much of a gamer, someone in their 40s or 50s. The game is just.... slow. The overwatch-styled hud will mislead you, its not ANYWHERE near as fast paced or responsive. The game is full of shambling enemies that are effectively walking health sponges. Moving around doesn't feel fluid and dynamic. The powerups are roguelike and kind of interesting but you're really just stuck with your 3 abilities and they arent all that interesting truth be told. The whole game is really just... good on paper poor in play. Almost as if the people making the game are good at... pen and paper games... and not dynamic action games....

I played as Maggie the wizard, the only of the four characters marked at 3/3 difficulty. It was not hard, despite somehow at the very start I lit myself on fire and spent the rest of the 20 minutes at 30% hp. No, it was mundane and boring. You start with a fire book as your weapon, and the standard attack is a fire puff. When I say puff, I really mean it, you have to be right on top of someone for it to even hit them. Okay sure, I'll just use the strong attack, charging up a fireball to lob at people. That worked well, outside of the fact that doing this spends your "energy" aka mana aka stamina so the entire time I played, for 20 minutes, was me just slowly charging and lobbing a few fireballs and then needing to wait to restore my energy and lobbing more. The enemies whether skeletal or mushroom in nature, wordlessly appear and shamble forth. Of my three abilities, one was a teleport, a shield, and a summoned bird that acted as a peashooter turret. So basically the next twenty minutes was nothing but slowly lobbing fireballs at walking sponges. It just tells me that there's some clear issues in the game loop and weapon/skill design. When your core game loop feels like you're kind of just existing and swimming through molasses, you have to go back and tune it up.

There are some other things that bothered me. I did die once, because a mushroom-person spawned behind me, wordlessly and without sound. Normally in a game there would be SOUND to help you there. Thankfully I was playing with a random who picked me back up. There's no indication on how long this takes for the person on the receiving end, which is kind of basic game design guys. The "tutorial" is just a bunch of popups on your screen with endless "dont show this tutorial again" checkboxes to check. All of which pops up when you first enter a game, so hopefully you share my experience in trying to matchmake and finally land a game only to be standing there for a minute reading and then disconnect from the host. Character selection is also a bit weird, its a neat concept to have all the characters sitting there, but the way they look up at you is super uncanny valley. The loading screen is the mythforce logo with the guy saying "MYTH FORCEEEE!", I am unsure if that plays every time but god DAMN I can see that getting annoying.

Again, its like the people who made this game are an era behind. It feels like they are too used to pen and paper rules, that they designed all of this in a box and translated that to a game while never sitting down to make it feel fluid and dynamic. It feels like they know how dnd works and how to make a custom campaign and character backstories, but then looked to modern games like overwatch to try to design their game around without understanding anything about gameplay. This is your dad's video game.

author: {'steamid': '76561199092780243', 'num_games_owned': 64, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3991, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3828, 'last_played': 1711059484}

author: {'steamid': '76561198004898148', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 105, 'playtime_at_review': 1860, 'last_played': 1712441672}
review: There are plenty of bugs and clunky UX. But every patch [i]significantly[/i] improves the game's stability, UX, and balance, and those patches are coming quite fast. Given the rapid pace of development, I think this should probably still be considered Early Access... but as an Early Access game, it's great. Works fine solo, but obviously better co-op.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967402765', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 210, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 157, 'last_played': 1704771318}
review:
A lot of the negative reviews for this game does have some truth behind it.  Combat was quite slow, movement was sluggish and perks/gear/upgrades were quite lame.  Since the most recent update called the, "Combat Action Improvement," there has been a dramatic improvement of the game.  I'd normally jump into a game, sink into my chair and just take my time and not really care how things go.  Now, with the new combat, it feels more engaging and action-y and I actually look forward to playing.  

The game isn't super complicated, combat is simplish (block, perfect parries, stamina balancing), upgrades aren't too complicated and the game can get a bit tough in certain parts.  I'm sure once I play some more and level up the gear and items I collect, I'll probably become a powerhouse, like in most roguelikes.  

I'll put it this way: Pre-patch, I would have maybe recommended it to one of my friends.  Post Patch, I'd recommend it to everyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028750871', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 136, 'playtime_forever': 258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1702768777}

author: {'steamid': '76561198026251500', 'num_games_owned': 359, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1282, 'last_played': 1702762785}
review:
If you are coming from fast paced games such as Roboquest or Gunfire Reborn, then you need to manage your expectations with this one.

First of all, this game is clearly meant to be enjoyed with atleast 1 other person when playing. Playing solo isn't a bother, but the slow pace and even the banter from the characters just becomes much more enjoyable with a friend.
Secondly, the game seems to be made much more for "enjoyment" rather than "excitement" in general - that being said, there are bosses and mini-bosses that provide a fair bit of challenge. You will run into situations, depending on which character you have chosen, where you will need to revise how you play and how you use the different mechanics of the game to tackle this obstacle.

Outside of a few bugs and (for some reason) near invulnerable enemies, this game is a treat for the eyes and mind with the right group of friends. I usually play more fast paced games but I've been thoroughly enjoying this game.
The end-game meta upgrades can be a bit of a grind, but it hasn't stopped being fun as you try harder difficulties and find new perk combinations that makes your setup shine. Getting a lucky equipment or perk early in a run can change the tide quite significantly in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045986966', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 853, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 158, 'last_played': 1703554895}
review:
Notes:
- Gameplay consists of procedurally generated room-to-room runs of approx. 30 mins with an upgrade perk after each one.
- Combat is fun and distills much of the feel of Tiny Tina's Wonderlands into a tidy roguelike.
- There's plenty to upgrade, and plenty to customize about your kit, with different weapon types and favored items.
- Stat upgrades are handled by a 'constellation' system where you can slot different types of improvements into different slots. i.e., a combat slot could be fit with a gem to increase physical attack, defense, attack speed, or combat cooldown, while a utility slot could be fit for crit damage, health, total energy, or ult cooldown.
- The graphics are kitschy and nostalgic, especially if you grew up watching cartoons from the late 80s.

Let's address the feedback on the Steam page first of all. Most of that comes from before the most recent patch that corrected a lot of problems, but it's still a new game with very few reviews, so each individual review will swing the stats wildly. It's not going to win any awards, but it's a fun romp well worth the half-priced (maybe not full priced) admission. I've played with some randos, which went well, but I'll bet it's a blast with friends. It currently supports crossplay between Steam and Epic, though it is available for all consoles. There's definitely room for the game to grow. It feels a bit like a final-stage early access title, but the devs are taking tons of feedback and working to improve it more than it already has.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015768220', 'num_games_owned': 346, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1701650995}
review:
Despite being a full release, the game feels the same (or even a bit worse) as it was during the demo - decent base, but needs some work to get it to be fun. Core mechanics are in place, but content is very lackluster. The need to grind for metaprogression to get decent raw stats and unlock higher tier upgrades made me not want to continue after beating the first major boss. I started 4th level and seen that my character is back to lvl 1 and takes around 10 attacks to kill 1 basic skeleton even after dropping the difficulty to normal, so either I am missing raw stats or it's just normal that enemies become damage sponges, neither of which is fun. Maybe (big maybe) if all metaprogression was shared between characters it would be less painful to grind it out, but in the current state I can't make myself continue to at least finish the whole game on single difficulty. Luckily I received the game for free, because otherwise I'd be rather disappointed even at half a price for the experience compared to other similar games. I only played single player, so multi player experience might be slightly different.

[u]Positives[/u]
- Visuals are nice
- Access to both melee and ranged combat with every class

[u]Negatives[/u]
- Too repetitive due to lack of room layouts, interesting upgrades (you'll see almost the same perks, weapon upgrades, and items every run), and very little weapon changes
- Items are quite rare to find outside of 2 shop rooms per run, and they give such small bonuses at low tier (in demo you could get any tier immediately and felt like they were dropped more frequently. Even then items felt only OK-ish, mostly few generic buffs that aren't too noticeable). Most chests and pots in the rooms just drop gold to be used in those shops that each contain 6 items in total
- Higher tier upgrades (perks, weapon upgrades, gems, and items) are locked behind metaprogression which takes many runs to upgrade everything
- Most metaprogression upgrades are not shared between characters, so you have to grind them with each character
- Difficulty is severely gated behind metaprogression upgrades (I went into 3rd level on hard with "new" character and I did 11 critical damage to the first boss which had 6k HP despite having perk that makes me deal 75% more damage. It took me probably 10 minutes to kill it with the help of environmental fire trap because I had no raw stat upgrades from metaprogression; the run got much more tolerable few rooms after when I got some stat boosts)
- Some ability upgrades have buffs only for allies which is disappointing for single player experience

author: {'steamid': '76561197970726608', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1061, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 30, 'playtime_at_review': 486, 'last_played': 1712335025}
review: I've seen a lot of negative reviews that point towards the game being slow; I can see if as a solo player in the first level. This game shines with Co-op, it speeds up and the challenge level increases with modifiers that definitely allow you to customize your characters differently every run. It can be a grind and could benefit from a little optimization for sure (looking at you, not shared gold across characters), but we're definitely having fun in this romp through 80's nostalgia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121582083', 'num_games_owned': 617, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1701546231}
review:
I recently decided to try out Mythforce because of some positive reviews started to role in and it was on  sale. Unfortunately, the game fell short of expectations due to performance issues and glitches.

The game ran poorly, with constant stuttering that made the overall experience frustrating.

I repeatedly encountered a glitch where my rogue character got stuck with the bow out, preventing them from attacking. This issue disrupted the flow of the game and created frustrating situations.

Despite potential positive aspects, such as fun movement and an overall appealing looking game, technical problems overshadowed any redeeming qualities, making the overall experience less enjoyable. Keep in mind I played this game for 20 minutes.
developer_response:
Hey there Oshova! We just released a massive patch where we reworked abilities, movement, and all other actions:

https://steamcommunity.com/games/363860/announcements/detail/6864112816152092535

Among other fixes, it fixes the issue of getting stuck with your weapon.

review: At the time of writing I have 7 hours in this game, and have made it through half the current levels solo normal mode. Thats not to say i haven't tried out harder difficulty. While there are some glitches in the game (Rapid heavy attack abuse, primary weapon fire getting stuck sometimes, targeting with the rush attack) the game-play is interesting. My only complaint is that most of the character ability for the mage just kinda suck. slow fall is useless and is easily outmatched by every other midair ability, the teleport is nice but the cool-down is a bit much, the turret is ok but useless if it ends up missing all the time, and the sheild is underwhelming for an ultimate. Fortunately its not my top character to play. There are some cool things you can do in this game though (Such as using the rouges double jump and a dash attack to mover super quick almost anywhere) and this game is for sure going places.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004625267', 'num_games_owned': 3306, 'num_reviews': 227, 'playtime_forever': 711, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 696, 'last_played': 1701460938}
review:
Verdict: As some other reviews mentioned the game falls into the mediocre category. The fact that you need to grind for every character separately is what pushed it to not recommended for me 

Better choices: Roboquest, Vermintide or Gunfire Reborn


+
Steam achievements (23)
Amazing style
The main heroes are fun to listen to (for the first time)
Getting that 80s' vibe devs were going for
All of the cinematics are pretty dope 
Beautifully cheesy 

-
A lot of bugs (shrines spawning one over another, getting stuck, inability to attack ...)
No Steam trading cards
Heroes are incredibly unbalanced
Besides Glyphs, meta currency and progression are specific so you need to grind for every character solo (making it near impossible to play them on harder difficulty if you didn't main them previously)
Too grindy honestly ... it takes like 2 hours to upgrade a weapon later on 
Really repetitive gameplay
9 levels but they feel like 3 with changes in their last sections
Level - 16 arena rooms that roll from the poll of 5-7 
Everything (even emotes and voice lines) has to be bought with meta-currency 
It is the most useless level-up system I have ever seen (no decisions and enemies scale in about 1 room)
Your teammates block your projectiles and spells which makes mixed groups frustrating
Content doesn't scale with the amount of players correctly - single-player is then much harder than multiplayer 
No integrated voice chat or even real chat - you can only emote each other
Low enemy variety (most are just reskins from one race to another)
Even if the crosshair tells you 'it's a hit' don't believe it - precise shots (arrows) often miss even then since some enemies wobble around when they move
Loot, perks and talents are uninspired at best
developer_response:
Hi Ascate
Thanks for all the detailed feedback.
Work is already well underway addressing alot of the points of friction you detail in your review.
This includes, but is not limited to; an overhaul of the metagame to reduce the grind, reworking of perk/hero abilities,  making combat encounters more dynamic, and ironing out the remaining bugs.
Stay tuned for our patch announcements.
We hope you give them a try!

author: {'steamid': '76561197997350766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 5021, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 67, 'playtime_at_review': 597, 'last_played': 1712326692}
review:
mythforce rips
anyone who says it feels sluggish doesn't know how to experiment. let me give you a tip
melee dash attacks can be used mid-air if you sprint into a jump - be more aggressive, reposition and herd those baddies.
if you jump right after inputting a melee dash attack, you can get even more speed and clear entire rooms, it's like a hyperdash. spike pits are fake (except for the enemies)
hold right-click, then tap left-click to either shield bash or swipe with the parrying dagger. shield bash can perma-stun enemies; dagger swipe automatically crits prone enemies - knock them over with a dash attack first.
the spellbooks are fantastic for AoE, combined with the Hunter's black hole ability you have your very own magical meatgrinder (Family-Friendly Edition)
the Knight is a runaway train of a bumper car, i like running double melee on her. greatsword's dash attack windup time is long enough that you travel the full distance of the hyperdash before absolutely cleaving whatever unfortunate souls (do skeletons have souls??) found on your selfmade train tracks.
the Mage and Rogue are fun too, every character is unique but i wanna keep it brief. thx

devs have said they'll focus on refining progression systems (making them more horizontal instead of vertical) which cleans up my biggest issue
play the game

-- i originally reviewed this at 10 hours of playtime. now im at 40. game still rips btw

author: {'steamid': '76561198019278296', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1705993238}
review:
Alright, I think it's fair to leave my opinion of the game in its current state considering it's half off right now, and this was a game I wanted to play solo [b]and[/b] with friends.

This game uses Horizontal FOV, and not Vertical FOV, meaning it doesn't fully support ultrawidescreen. At 105 field of view(maxed) it looks like it's 50 fov in comparison. Just run the game in 16:9/21:9 for this reason.

For using higher video settings, this game chugs along for its post processing. I'm running on a 3090, and it was still unable to get up to 60fps. You can run it at Medium settings. Looks pretty good there too since its art lends to lower settings pretty well.

The perks and skills during the beginning are lacking. Although.. I've seen significantly better strides in other games making perks feel augmentative (really changes the gameplay just by having that said perk) in other games. For this, I really feel like they could do a lot to make the first time experience better in that regard. 

The gameplay feels slow. There are skills that make you move faster, but during combat it's very situational so I didn't find myself dashing around as much as I thought I would. The enemies you fight during the beginning are generally three archetypes; skeletons (melee/ranged), little guys that run at you, and mush-daddies(melee/magic). It's fine, ig. Arguably though, when looking at how it feels to attack enemies, I'm 50/50 on that. The melee feels really good imo, but as a hunter, something just felt really lacking. I think the animation for drawing arrows felt slow and it didn't feel like it had that [i]thwip[/i] you'd expect from it.

The audio feels like the design is good, but there are a few conflicts. For example, GUDs came out awkward after using dashes and after battles (this one particularly confused me; out of 10 rooms, like 3 of them which seemed normal got the special privilege of my guy saying something, which felt random to me). There wasn't any real punchy sounds which was probably by choice but it felt a little too static for my liking. When you use your ultimate (T) it didn't match up with the background music that well either. I just ended up skipping my ult for that reason. 

The art is absolutely gorgeous. The skills and how pretty they looked was really nice.

Ultimately, if you wanted a piece of art, this game does it. :) But, if you're looking for a fully fledged game I don't feel like I could recommend it at this time. It's going to take a lot of time before this feels like a full release, and it has so SO much potential that I'm going to be excited for it later. But for those on the fence; if you want a slow progression with repetitive gameplay that over time it evolves to something magical, maybe.. just maybe.. it might be worth the 50% off.

But in the meantime, keep following Beamdog's community posts until you start seeing tons of likes on them. And if you want to play with friends, yeah, it'd probably do for now if you just wanna shoot with the bois.

For the hopes of this game getting better, it gets a thumbs up. But really, in its current state, it's worth $15 just for the art, not the gameplay, the audio is also 50/50, and with an hour on this I really can't say anything about the story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038863972', 'num_games_owned': 2607, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1701337327}
