author: {'steamid': '76561198040950665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1701247695}
review:
TL:DR the game is bad, and you should go play Robotquest, Ravenswatch, or hell even Gunfire Reborn if you are looking for a new roguelike to play. 

I don't normally write reviews, but this game made me so disappointed that i had to. I returned this game after only an hour and that was with me playing the game with a friend.

Let me start off by saying this game, even without the bugs, would not be good. The only "saving grace" this game has is it's theme. Beyond that though it falls flat in almost every regard in terms of a roguelike. I tried REALLY hard to like this game but I couldn't.


Combat: A horrible mess.
The combat and movement is extremely clunky, slow, and due to what i assume are bugs? There was many times where I'd attack an enemy and the attack would just do nothing. Literally had arrows passing through enemies and hitting the enemies behind them. Melee attacks whiffing at point blank range, etc.

Additionally, the enemy AI in this game is terrible. They will walk into walls, and sometimes just straight stand there looking at you and do nothing. Had one enemy once that just start spinning in place.

Enemy variation was also lacking. Granted i played for only an hour before returning it? I only saw two enemy types the entire time i played. Which essentially were just dudes who walked at you or threw stuff at you.

When the Enemies do act proper things can get rather frustrating. There are certain enemies that will knock you down if they hit you. The problem with this is, the time that it takes to stand back up? It has already hit you with another attack that knocks you back down.



Level Design: Repetitive. 
The level design in this game is extremely repetitive even for a roguelike. In an hour of playtime I saw the same exact level designs repeated multiple times. Even in separate chapters. 


Perks and Leveling: No meaningful choices.
The perks in this game are so uninspiring and bland. For an example your standard perk options are something along the lines of: "Deal 20 more damage" "Your weapon now does Ice damage" "Heal for 1hp when defeating an enemy" Not once did I run into any perks that I thought were engaging or build defining like other games in this genre. Nor did i find any perks that seemed to synergize that well. When I did find something that was remotely interesting it was so underwhelming that simply attacking normally was more efficient. 


Characters: Lacking. 
This is one area that I thought was going to be this games saving grace but I was wrong. I thought this game was going to be filled to the brim with character quips, and interactions that would be funny. But they were sadly silent for the most part. To me this is the biggest pain point for me in this game as it was the thing that sort of drew me in.

author: {'steamid': '76561199081655971', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1701299610}
review:
this game is got mostly all the right part to be a fun roguelike ITS JUST NOT THERE YET! 
the combat feel just off, there is no weight to it and it feels floaty 
its NOT optimized AT ALL for me to get it to run better i had to crank everything to ULTRA??? explain how that makes any scene what so ever lol
I REALLY REALLY wanted to like this game

maybe in a year it will be better with better combat, level design and optimization
dont buy unless you wanna support the devs bc if THEY do keep working on it i think it will make for  a great game some day!

author: {'steamid': '76561198058929440', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 384, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 242, 'last_played': 1701884816}
review: If I could, I would give this a "meh" review. It's.... not awful... but it's aesthetic only. The game itself is honestly pretty bad and boring. There are so many competing games that do it better. If you want to have fun, check out Roboquest and Gunfire Reborn for a similar game style but MUCH better gameplay. And that's saying something since Roboquest has its issues too. Now, if you want to just enjoy the aesthetic and you can forgive the game design, then maybe it's worth it. Just don't pay full price. It's NOT worth anywhere near $30.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060219935', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1701291939}
review:
Die Bewertung ist aus Sicht eines Einzelspielers, wirklich Spaß macht es wohl nur mit mehreren. Da auch einige Fertigkeiten und Gegenstände darauf ausgelegt sind.
"Mythforce" dieser Ausruf wenn man die Force zündet ist einfach geil, allerdings ist das schon alles. Dem Rest der Musik fehlt es an dem Besonderen. Keine Power.
Die Level sind allerdings schön gestaltet! Ein guter Zeichenstil.

Die Übersetzung hat teils noch Nachholbedarf und manche Benennungen erscheinen mir einfach unstimmig im deutschen.
Die Lobby braucht definitiv eine bessere Erklärung, andere werden beim ersten Start einer Runde automatisch aufgedrängt. Die aufzubauende Stadt muss man selbst herausfinden, trotz des Fragezeichens oben links. Habe ich das erst nicht mitbekommen.
Die Gegner brauchen dringend irgendwelche Geräusche, außer einem sehr leisen Treffergeräusche. Irgendein klappern der Skelette oder anderes.
Die hitbox ist für Pfeile einfach nur grauenhaft, besonders, da die Gegner unberechenbar herumwackeln. Manchmal gehen Pfeile auch einfach durch Köpfe durch. 

Wenn das schon die "bessere Version" nach den Patches ist, will ich gar nicht wissen wie es vorher aussah.
Kein Wunder, dass solche Spiele immer wieder verschwinden oder teils nach Ankündigung diese zurückgezogen wird. Es scheint sehr schwer zu sein, hier etwas vernünftiges zu erschaffen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044067986', 'num_games_owned': 755, 'num_reviews': 158, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1701270875}
review:
Coming from Roboquest, it's hard to appreciate Mythforce.

It's slow, repetitive (I manage to have the same very specifically collapsed corridor layout thrice on the same level) and bugged (twice in my run, my character was unable to perform any attack or swap weapons after using one ability-the aggro buff of the tank lady-, only waiting the cooldown to refresh and re-use it, fixed the issue). 

It's just not fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040842863', 'num_games_owned': 1887, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1701060361}

author: {'steamid': '76561197976795452', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1083, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1006, 'last_played': 1706936111}
review:
I've been playing since the first round of beta testing so I have seen this game change and improve quite a bit since then. Overall, the latest releases have made this a game that most could casually pick up and enjoy with friends while still having enough to satisfy the fans of the genre. The art style and enemy design are fun while 
 the rooms making up the "episodes" are varied enough for the multiple playthroughs required to improve your characters.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020581818', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 1451, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 255, 'playtime_at_review': 1391, 'last_played': 1712363228}
review:
Man, this feels exactly like the best Saturday morning cartoon that I never watched. Pretty solid fps roguelite.

Pros:
+The vibes are absolutely amazing. This really is like 5 different +s - graphics, plot, voice-acting, design, music, videos, all feel like a better version of the og Thundercats cartoon.
+The combat is good once you get the hang of it.
+The 2nd and 3rd chapters are pretty awesome.
+The different playable characters feel genuinely different from each other and all seem to play well.

Cons:
-The first chapter is kinda lame. They say they're working on fixing it, but as of right now, you have to power through three levels of bs until you get to the much more fun stuff. EDIT: mostly fixed! Much better.
-A little buggy, a little residual jank. Some people report a ton of bugs, but I've only had enemies get stuck inside their spawn zones a few times. 
-Balancing. Not surprising, since it's just out, but how exactly is melee or archery anywhere near as effective as magic, for example?
-Light on content. There are only 9 levels, almost all of which are procedurally generated from a small set of rooms, and, as I said, the first 3 levels basically suck. EDIT: they increased the number of tilesets for the rooms, made them more interesting as a whole, and also made them less likely to spawn in repetitive ways. Huge improvement.

The dev has spoken about what they're working on in the near term, if not a full roadmap, so hopefully they continue working on and supporting it.

EDIT: they have fixed most of the cons in the most recent update! Specifically, the first 3 chapters are much better than before and feel much more dynamic/interesting, far less of a slog.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968605634', 'num_games_owned': 252, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 197, 'last_played': 1701132849}

author: {'steamid': '76561198020456739', 'num_games_owned': 768, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1703434663}
review:
Posted Dec 24th after the update for Dec 14th to improve combat glitches:
I played the first stage all the way through with 2 different characters, halfway through on my second play through my weapon again wouldn't fire even tho this has been listed as fixed. This time it started working again after using an ability (previously even though this was listed as how to fix it while being stuck unable to attack, it hadn't worked for me). 

Posted Nov 27th:
Wanted to give this a fair shot but could not. In the first room after killing about 7 mobs my attack button would no longer work and either would my change weapon button. I could still do everything else so I was killing things with my abilities and waiting for my cooldowns to come back. Looked online and apparently there are a bunch of known issues like this and honestly I'm just not willing to play something where the main core feature doesn't work sometimes especially since it's not early access. If this was fixed I'd be willing to give it another shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056366385', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1701046315}
review:
I played very little, but I can tell it's one of those "With a party it's better" games. It feels very good, it also needs some polish. The edge detection and the toon shader are really really really good, props to whoever worked on that side.

-I would like to see more particle effects, when enemies spawn, when you pick up something and some interactions feel a little tame as well. That first mission needs to hype up your entire game. 
-The tutorial needs a lot (A LOT) of work, right now it's just 1000 different static screens describing what's what at the beginning of the mission. Just a voice over with subtitles would make a difference.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010341438', 'num_games_owned': 262, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1701035708}
review: There are so many things that are awesome about this game, and some things that need improvement. The art, the music, the core gameplay, the characters, all incredible. However, one class is severely overtuned compared to the rest, and some of the classes just feel clunky due to melee range being so incredibly short. Things that can be improved over time, and I hope that they do. But still a very fun game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198109041809', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1700929347}
review:
tl;dr: If you want a deepish rpg/roguelike experience go play Barony instead, this is more of a FPS.

Honestly, for what it is it's an okay game, but you can't go into it and expecting a dungeon crawling experience like Barony (which is a great roguelike game which I highly recommend).

What this is however is more like a FPS which you're supposed to enjoy with friends. Exploration is minimal and the enemies are predictable and come in waves. Levelling up and powering up is also trivial.

I think overall this game wasn't marketed correctly, so take the above into consideration before buying!

author: {'steamid': '76561198113263243', 'num_games_owned': 218, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 3324, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1145, 'last_played': 1702378866}
review:
In spite of the prevalent negative feedback regarding game mechanics, bugs, and clunky controls, I approached MythForce with unwavering optimism. I'm pleased to report that it exceeded my expectations.

Regarding Bugs:
I did encounter occasional setbacks, such as getting stuck on the floor with skeletons descending upon me from elevated positions. There were instances when my primary attack button didn't respond unless I initiated special powers to "unstick" my attacks.

While all games have their share of bugs, issues tend to be resolved over time. Admittedly, investing in a game with known bugs isn't an ideal gameplay experience. However, I haven't encountered any game-breaking bugs so far—fingers crossed for continued smooth gameplay.

XP Leveling:
The game's approach to XP leveling might deter some players since in-level XP doesn't persist. Although you progress through stages and episodes, your level doesn't carry over when revisiting earlier episodes. Yet, the game doesn't solely rely on in-level levels or XP. Strength is gained by collecting glyphs, gems, and gold, creating a prolonged and challenging grind.

You advance through Armory/Sun Disc Tiers, acquiring weapons and enhancing stats with gems. The learning curve may initially suggest a straightforward Hack/Slash style, but it requires subtle strategy, especially when playing solo on higher difficulties. Environmental utilization and precise timing become crucial.

Nostalgia:
The game boasts beautiful graphics, fluid animations, and seamlessly integrated mechanics. Co-op mode adds a humorous touch to the experience, delivering on the promised Saturday Morning Cartoon vibe. Similar to classic 80s/90s games, restarting from the beginning upon death can be frustrating, but understanding the mechanics improves with progression.

Replayability and Final Thoughts:
Every playthrough or replay offers a unique experience as each stage is randomly generated. The increasing difficulty requires extensive grinding to prove your worth. In my first day of play, I dedicated a solid 10 hours to the game. Despite its initial toughness, the grind proves immensely fulfilling, with each hour spent feeling worthwhile. The absence of a paywall for cosmetics is a definite positive. Whether you team up with friends for added fun or embark on a solo grind to showcase your prowess, MythForce offers a compelling and rewarding gaming experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999239696', 'num_games_owned': 806, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1706732034}
review:
I absolutely love this game. I played a little bit solo just to test it out and had enough fun that I recommended it to my friends. After a 5 hour play session, we all wanted to come back for more. 
Cons:
The lobby/permanent upgrade menus could use a little bit more guidance, it was not completely obvious that the buildings in the background of the lobby were upgrade shops and I think they could use some signage so you don't have to click through them trying to remember what is where.
The difficulty jumps up in chunks, you will obliterate enemies in one room and then potentially get slaughtered like cattle in the next.
Needs a more room variation per tile set. There are multiple areas in the game with their own aesthetic but within each area it feels like you see the same 6 rooms infinitely.
Pros:
This is a fantastic co-op experience! Lobbies were easy to set up and manage, we had little to no connection problems.
The characters and abilities all feel unique, satisfying and good in their roles.
The in game dialogue between the characters is fun and adds a lot of flavor to the game.
Do yourself a favor, pick Maggie's ice tome, hold down the attack button, profit.
You don't have to pick a different character than your friends which means no one is locked out of a character they want to play but I suggest trying a team of all 4 characters because some of the ability combinations are wild.

author: {'steamid': '76561199163417933', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1700844871}
review:
I want to like the game but it just isn't fun or engaging enough to continue playing. Right off the bat I have encountered some bugs that prevented me from attacking. It happens when shooting a bow. I managed to unfreeze my character by spamming abilities and eventually I could use normal attacks.

As far as I know with my little time with the game, there is no customisation or perma loot / equipment. Characters are pre-defined which is fine I guess but it would have been better to make your own hero.
I haven't seen any inventory aside from character screen and any loot that drops is replaced by a new one. This for me is a deal breaker. A dungeon crawler with no cool loot aside from minor upgrades ( like boots that give 5% more movement speed ).... now I get it it's also a roguelike but this could have been done better. Many games in the genre offer some sort of reward that players can either carry over to the next run or unlock better perma equipment and the starting area. 

Another minor gripe is the fact that any loot does not show on your character. 

Moral of the story is : The game is not for me. It may get better but I don't want to go over my refund window so it is what it is.

Worst of all : Epic Online Services. Nuff said.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003348360', 'num_games_owned': 1718, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 107, 'last_played': 1700780961}

author: {'steamid': '76561198029796414', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 366, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 20, 'playtime_at_review': 192, 'last_played': 1712351983}
review: I'm feeling elements/influences from games like Void Bastards, Dark & Darker, Darkest Dungeon and HeroQuest all beautifully delivered with a Masters of the Universe aesthetic. Having a good time so far and it seems the devs are continuing to improve and add to the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968304707', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 66, 'last_played': 1700767464}
review:
Absolutely love the art style.  I get the thematic hook.  Some notes:
The game moves and feels like it's on ambien.  Very slow, soggy movement and combat.  The smallest of drops damage you.  The arenas are very samey, I'd recommend looking into something like Mothergunship or Roboquest for level layout ideas.  The voice-work is nice, the dialog is okay, but for being a Saturday morning cartoon, i was hoping to hear more amusing lines.  I'd also like to see an introduction in a king's room or something, something to get the quest going.  Love the intro movie.  The upgrade system is good, the specials ( the T special) didn't seem to do anything?  Other than play the song.  Had some issues with lag and connecting to a game with friends.

all in all, it wasn't for me, but good luck!
developer_response:

author: {'steamid': '76561197963570731', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1040, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1700957822}
review:
Довольно неплохая игра для кооператива. Неспешная и без заморочек. Играем с женой, получаем удовольствие. 

хотелось бы добавить для разработчика некоторые комментарии: Очень нужно увеличить максимальный FOV (105 это мало) игра слишком близко или добавить вид от третьего лица. и увеличить немного производительность или добавить AMD FSR.
Единственный баг который пока что поймал, это пропажа золота, нафармил 30к, зашел на след день а у меня 0.

но впечатление все равно положительное. игра будет топовой при условии быстрого развития и добавления неоднотипных локаций.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067666343', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 4975, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 67, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1712351551}
review:
Ho acquistato questo gioco nonostante sia ancora acerbo essenzialmente per due motivi:

Punto primo conosco la Beamdog avendo avuto modo di collaborare con loro durante la localizzazione delle versioni Enhanced di Baldur's Gate. So come lavorano e quanto sono competenti ed attenti ai feedback, per cui sono sicuro che riusciranno a limare tutto quello che nel gioco non va rendendolo alla fine un prodotto pulito. Sostanzialmente il grosso dei problemi del gioco sono problemi tecnici che una volta risolti renderanno il gioco molto godibile e divertente. 

Se lo dovessi descrivere direi che si tratta di un Vermintide o di un Gunfire Reborn in salsa cartonesca anni 80 (anche se con sessioni platform e trappole che strizzano un pochino l' occhio al mitico Dragon' s Lair) a me ha ricordato oltre che il già citato Dragon' s Lair anche He-Man (Le citazioni sono innegabili) e Viosionaries. 

E questo ci porta al punto due.. Definirei questo un prodotto di nicchia che per gli amanti del genere cresciuti in quegli anni è immancabile. Quando ero piccolo immaginavo un futuro in cui laser game come Dragon's Lair e Space Ace potessero essere giocabili in maniera più approfondita piuttosto che spammare tasti qua e la. Quel futuro finalmente è arrivato ed è giocabile anche in compagnia!

review:

Purtroppo l’estetica cartoon anni ‘80 non basta a sorreggere un gioco che tra le sue fondamenta ha un gameplay povero e ripetitivo, che lascia presto spazio alla noia. In compagnia potrebbe guadagnare qualche punto, ma non basta a salvarlo dalla mediocrità.

review: Очень сильно так себе, три негативных фактора в совокупности не дают рекомендовать игру: нет динамики боя, нет разнообразия, одинаковые комнаты слишком часто повторяются. Интерес к игре пропал очень быстро
developer_response:
Добрый день! Спасибо за отзыв. В то время, как это может показаться верным на втором часу игры, я бы рекомендовал продолжить в следующих эпизодах. Когда Вы достигнете Склепа (эпизод 4), разнообразие существенно вырастет, а новые враги и их способности сделают бой динамичным.

Также следует отметить, что мы работаем уже над улучшениями, которые прямо отвечают на Ваш фидбек.

И снова здравствуйте (15.12.2023). Только что выпустили патч, попробуйте:

https://steamcommunity.com/games/363860/announcements/detail/6864112816152092535

author: {'steamid': '76561197970929757', 'num_games_owned': 711, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 398, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1710910340}
review: I like this game well enough and it's graphics are what stood out to me the most. It's very pretty and anybody who watched cartoons in the 1980's will appreciate it. The gameplay is where I have trouble describing it though. It feels kinda slow paced where the enemies walk slow and take tons of damage. I think some of the character classes can be balanced better such as ranged attacks are way more powerful than melee. I will definitely return to this one later to see its progress.
developer_response:
Hi there, thanks for your review! We'd encourage you to play more than 1.2 hours because it gets much more intense in Episodes after 1.

We're already hard at work on the next patch that will focus on improvements in your moment-to-moment combat experience focusing on responsiveness, combat flow, and improving the functionality of your abilities.

Edit: Hi again! We just released a massive update focusing on addressing that issue and otherwise improving your moment-to-moment player combat experience.

Please try it out!

https://steamcommunity.com/games/363860/announcements/detail/6864112816152092535

author: {'steamid': '76561198303321002', 'num_games_owned': 469, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 668, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1705214584}
review:
I'll be honest, on release i agreed with all the negative reviews. The game was very buggy and my friends and I had a lot of issues.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039406214', 'num_games_owned': 1747, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 3357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 642, 'last_played': 1704634140}
review:
Ok :
- Des passages secret a découvrir .
- La DA  unique en sont genre .
- La bande sons .
- 4 personnage avec chacun sont style de combat (  armes, compétence ) 

Pas Ok :
- Seulement  3 biomes qui sont une suite de salle  placé aléatoirement  .
- Les ennemies qui apparaisse dans le dos .
- Vite répétitif .
- seul le niveau des bâtiments et partager entre les personnages, ils faut farm de nouveau, l'argent, les gemmes .
- Le End game c'est juste LOL, compter plusieurs heures juste pour up une arme niveaux maximum.
- Le farm,compter 30 minute pour 75 000 gold une arme en coute  1.5M du niveau 1 a 4 .
- Les gemmes niveau maximum sont uniquement craftable au prix de 10 du niveau précédent avec un taux de drop de 1 a 2 pars run.



Conclusion : Le jeux a une belle enveloppe, et la découverte et bonne, mais des qu'on y joue un peut plus trop on se retrouve face a un mur de farm, pour au final aucune récompense, tuer le meme boss  10 fois pour up sont stuff et le tuer en difficulté supérieur, c'est le principe d'un MMO pas d'un rogue like. 
Maj : end game

author: {'steamid': '76561198148885042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 360, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 7, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1712450728}
review: I really really like this game. I've been looking for a cartoony rouge-like dungeon crawler that gives me high FPS with very satisfying shooting for a long time- and this is it. I see a lot of people complaining about it getting repetitive, but I don't care. That excites me. I'm going to complete the game's 9 dungeons with one character, then go back and do the same with the other 3. Each time you load the level it has a slightly different layout anyways so it feel fresh and there's always the potential for the devs to add more characters and more chapters down the line. I only play solo and it's a breath of fresh air to engage in these fast paced fights with many enemies at once- very satisfying too I'll add again. If you this sounds fun to you, then you should consider buying it when it goes on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048588680', 'num_games_owned': 530, 'num_reviews': 212, 'playtime_forever': 551, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 551, 'last_played': 1696359993}
review:
Mythforce to "roguelite" z widokiem z pierwszej osoby. 
Docelowo traktowany jako produkcja kooperacyjna, 
gdzie mamy zebrać kilku chętnych znajomych, 
wcielić się w dość sztampowych herosów i stawić 
czoło nikczemnemu zagrożeniu. Zabawa solo oczywiście 
też jest możliwa, choć gra wtedy dużo traci na swoim 
uroku. Mythforce miało wyglądać jak spełnienie marzeń 
ludzi którzy wychowali się na rakich animacjach jak 
He-Man czy Thundercats. Film wprowadzający z wyjątkowo 
kiczowatym brzmieniem, to była muzyka dla mych uszu. 
Nawet jeśli nie do końca wiedziałem, o co w nim tak 
naprawdę chodzi. Było żywcem przeniesione ze wspomnianych 
bajkowych hitów. Do wyboru cztery archetypy postaci. 
Wojowniczka, łucznik, łotrzyk i czarodziejka. 
Każdy ze swoimi specjalnymi zdolnościami. 
Jedna rzuca tarczą niczym Kapitan Ameryka, 
a inna wyczarowuje sokoła walczącego u jej boku.
Całość dzieli się na epizody, a ukończenie jednego 
z nich sprawia, że nie musimy tam ponownie wracać. 
Progresja nietypowa dla "roguelitów", ale jak 
najbardziej zrozumiała biorąc pod uwagę długość 
takiej epizodycznej przygody składającej się 
z kilkunastu aren - około 40 min. Bo i na arenach się 
całość opiera. Tu akurat fani gatunku doskonale wiedzą, 
o co chodzi. Nie przyjdzie im wybierać nagród za pokonanie 
pomieszczenia, ale nie straszne im te ciasne przestrzenie. 
W każdej z nich czekają nas kolejne fale wrogów 
i tak aż do mety. Problem w tym, że różnorodności 
tu niewiele.  Pokoje są nudne. Skrzynie leżą w tych 
samych miejscach, wrogowie wyłażą z tych samych dziur, 
a i tymi wszystkimi murami idzie się srogo wynudzić.
Co pokój wybieramy sobie perki, ale to przeważnie 
ten nudny zestaw procentowo zwiekszający nam 
statystyki. Ziewanie jest trudne do zastopowania. 
Tym bardziej że system walki ma nie tyle wyczuwalny 
aromat drewna, co przysiadając do Mythforce’a, 
jesteśmy generycznym bobrem z Tajemnicy Wiklinowej 
Zatoki, niżeli He-Manem, którego nam obiecywano.
Pod kontem graficznym jest na prawdę bardzo dobrze.
Stylizacja animacji, wygląd przeciwników oraz otoczenia
robi wrażenie. Inaczej jest z oprawą dźwiękową.
Dźwięki strzałów, wybuchów oraz czarów są tak płytkie,
że czasami ciężko jest je usłyszeć, a muzyka kompletnie
nie pasuje do gry. Powolna, generyczna i nudna.
Podejrzewam, że gdyby zabrał się za to bardziej 
utalentowany zespół z większym budżetem to mógłby być
hit. A tak mamy całkowicie średnią produkcję.

Ocena: 6/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197989212961', 'num_games_owned': 599, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 2474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1707777658}
review:
Was hesitant about playing mythforce and only jumped in recently at patch 1.0.2.2.

So far the different classes feel nice, quite well balanced and each is fun to handle in their own right.
(have not tried out multiplayer yet and the next patch should improve that so might wait for that patch, so it is well playable as well in solo mode)
Each run takes about 30 minutes which feels nice enough length wise, not too long, not too short.

The melee combat takes a bit of getting used to as the reach of certain weapons like victorias mace feels a bit short so I missed a lot of swings as it feels like I need to stand right up to the enemy before being able to hit them, but is manageable, but I have found myself relying on the bow on those chars a lot as well.

Also encountered a bug I think where the attack would not start charging up again after just releasing a max attack, but could work around it.

The energy management feels nice at this moment, the added extra energy makes it quite usable and is forgiving if one messes up at the start. (yes you can not keep blasting or swinging but need to use the terrain as well in a tactical manner to not run out of energy)

The game is quite forgiving, nice 80's cartoon vibe, a lot of upgrades can be found everywhere.

For the grinding part, this is a roguelite and I can see that it will take many runs to get things at higher tier like the weapons, trinkets, cards one finds as well as the constellation (stat boost for the characters).
Edit : got pretty far with upgrades but for an ultimate build the grind will be quite extensive especially for the constellation, everything else seems manageable, but perhaps a shared coin and gem stash for the chars would help out so one can use a favorite char to boost a less favorite one.

As I am planning to play this game off and on in short bursts and the characters even without upgrades are well playable at least for the first levels and the few upgrades I bought started spawning in the world I felt a bit of progression. 

Edit : The lower levels of the thicket are pretty boring layout wise but once one hits the dungeons and castle the maps are more interesting, combat is basic but fun enough especially on harder difficulties where one is forced to rely on ones specials more.

If this game is on sale, and especially if the next patch has dropped as well, why not give it a try for a fun fling with or without friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198271508493', 'num_games_owned': 50, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1697013650}
review:
Vorab: Ich habe das Spiel zum Testen erhalten, da ich in einem anderen Projekt mitgeholfen habe.

Aber nun zum Spiel selbst. Grafisch her, wie es ja schon in der Beschreibung selbst steht, erinnert es an die damaligen 80iger Cartoons, He-Man oder Thundercats usw. Also noch meine Kindheitszeit (XD). Insgesamt finde ich das stimmig und das hat mich sogar gereizt es weiter zu spielen.

Solche "Shooter" sind normal nicht meins, aber ich musste zugeben, es hat Spaß gemacht. Besonders als ich die Figur fand, mit der ich am Besten klar kam. Da ich keinen Controller habe, spielte ich mit Tastatur und Maus. Die Anordnung der Buttons ist etwas Gewöhnungsbedürftig, kann man aber auch anpassen.

So was ich mit meiner begrenzten Testzeit heraus gefunden habe, ist größtenteils Positiv. Es gibt ein paar Punkte, an denen in meinen Augen noch gearbeitet werden sollte. Zum Beispiel, auch wenn ich größtenteils ohne MP gespielt habe, verliert das Spiel hin und wieder die Verbindung, auch wenn die Internetverbindung lokal (GigabitLAN) wunderbar funktioniert und kaum ausgelastet ist. Ich kam mit dem Fortschritt des Spiels einigermaßen zurecht, aber auch selbst bei Leicht zieht der Schwierigkeitsgrad echt schnell an, ohne das entsprechende Items zur Heilung usw kommen. Ich denke hier könnte am Balancing (schwere Sache, das ist mir selbst aus einem anderen Projekt bekannt) noch gearbeitet werden.

Das Spiel hat meiner Meinung nach potenzial und wenn daran weiter gearbeitet wird, könnte das mehr als was Gutes werden! In meinen Augen aber auch jetzt schon soweit spielbar, wenn auch noch Luft nach oben da ist.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106867787', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1666, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 171, 'last_played': 1707707902}

author: {'steamid': '76561197988186723', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1681, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1696804601}
review: Un juego de mazmorreo a lo Dungeons and dragons el estilo recuerda mucho a los dibujos de los 80/90s muy divertido, se ve muy mimado, hay intros como si fuera una serie de animación, tenemos tiendas de skins, habilidades y armas, no he tenido problemas para lanzarlo, no entiendo las reseñas negativas, acaba de salir el juego, la dificultad va de normal pasando por difícil y luego mítico 1 2 3 que sube mucho la dificultad y añade maldiciones, vida a los bichos y daño, lo hemos jugado con amigos y es espectacular, hemos empezado con la dificultad difícil y la verdad muy divertido 100% recomendado.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968321140', 'num_games_owned': 1075, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1772, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1715, 'last_played': 1704825990}
review:
I absolutely love this game and honestly makes me feel like I'm playing a cartoon show from my childhood.
Each character plays differently with my current favourite being the rouge thanks to his teleportation back-stab.

My only gripe so far is a couple of bugs in multiplayer which can affect range damage working, or not able to pick up items until you use an ability if connecting to a host but these will be fixed in time.

Hopefully Beamdog can build on this game to add more maps and random tiles to help keep things fresh,  as id happily shout MYTHFORCE while chopping up bad guys for a long time if they do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038657508', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1413, 'last_played': 1696005606}
review:
Le jeu est très beau, dans un style très maître de l'univers.

Par contre, il est devient rapidement assez répétitif, et le multi est très mauvais.
Pas de choix du niveau pour rejoindre une partie et bien souvent ça rame vu qu'à priori on héberge nos parties, donc si on rejoint une partie sur une co pas terrible et bien ça rame.

Je passe aussi sur les bugs, notamment au niveau du changement des armes.

Si vous le trouvez en solde prenez le, sinon le jeu comme il est actuellement ne vaut pas les 30€ demandé...
developer_response:
Salut! Merci beaucoup pour votre avis. Cela a contribué à améliorer le jeu et à le rendre meilleur.

Nous venons de publier une mise à jour massive de la qualité de vie qui corrige une tonne de problèmes, notamment concernant les problèmes multijoueurs précédents. Jetez-y un œil et faites-nous part de votre expérience de jeu.

En plus des améliorations que nous avons déjà ajoutées à la version 1.0.3.0, le prochain patch se concentrera sur des améliorations encore plus importantes de votre expérience de combat instantanée, en mettant l'accent sur la réactivité, le déroulement du combat et l'amélioration de la fonctionnalité de vos capacités.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972458965', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2583, 'last_played': 1704256345}
review:
I've gotten to watch this game develop through beta and early access, and it's become a solid game that's a blast to play.  The art style is a fantastic callback to cartoons of the 80s, and there are a lot of small details that show the amount of care and dedication the team has put into the game.

The combat doesn't feel slow or clunky at all, contrary to what some reviews are claiming.  Rather, the feel is much more deliberate and tactical than other horde games, allowing you to time your strikes and pick your shots.  If the frenetic, twitch based gameplay of similar games has turned you off to the genre, I'd definitely recommend giving this one a try.

author: {'steamid': '76561199155968375', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1695323953}
review:
My interest was piqued just like everyone else's: the look and feel, and the promise of being able to play in a world just like the Dungeons and Dragons TV cartoon I loved as a kid.

Unfortunately, this game turned out to be mostly look and feel covering up a mediocre, ho-hum game. It's not terrible by any means, but after during run #2 I wondered, "is this it? Is it just a glorified corridor hack n slash where I fight various skeletons over and over?" The skeletons hit you with swords from way, way farther away than their swords appear to swing, changing weapons in game is clunky, the action is repetitive even 15 minutes into the game.

By run #3 is wanted to quit even when I was doing ok. I felt, if I got to keep my level progress to run #4 then I'd keep the game. Nope, you have to start all the way over at level 1 each time. I have uninstalled the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198325329732', 'num_games_owned': 100, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1701993186}

author: {'steamid': '76561198007233260', 'num_games_owned': 2060, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1696893708}
review:
Far from perfect but a pretty fun game that manages to be both chill and chaotic at the same time. 

For negatives: the enemy/player balance feels off like it doesn't scale to the player count, bleeding out and dying is too fast and boring for fewer than 3 players and meta progression is relied on too heavily for loot to start becoming interesting.

The game does look great though and when loot gets interesting, it really adds a cool risk/reward element to the game. There's enough content and challenge at the moment to make me want to keep playing. It feels like a game that'll shine if you can get a full group on voice good chat and music playing.

We need dinosaurs, voice lines for standard enemies and multiple paths so I'm hoping there's plans for a lot more development. The game really does feel like it was made for 4 players so if you can, I would wait for a sale and try to convince friends to grab the game or split a 4 pack on sale from Humble. You can join or have random people drop into your games but you then run the risk of encountering loot goblins.

Good game that just needs friends and some quality of life stuff work!

author: {'steamid': '76561198078769869', 'num_games_owned': 175, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 251, 'last_played': 1697330124}
review: A vast majority of the negative reviews I have seen seem to simply come from bad connection with the exception of some complaints about grinding, or mechanics. However; I for one have been having a blast with my gaming buddy. Love the art style as well as the mechanics and aside from a one *minor* bug with Victoria's Shield Throw occasionally causing a stuck animation, I'm absolutely adoring the game. The only real complaint I do have about any of the common "issues" is that the grind for glyphs can be a bit extraneous, but overall I'd give a solid 7.5/10 and am going to keep having a blast!

author: {'steamid': '76561198047133154', 'num_games_owned': 496, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 501, 'last_played': 1694662207}
review:
Great style, great art, weak gameplay and general lack of 'wow' moments. We've got a million roguelikes already and the least I'd hope for is something kinetic, impactful and rewarding for me taking the time and money to learn a system and get into it.
The only way to play with friends was to spam quick match enough times that we eventually find one another as I can't really crossplay between steam and epic.
Substance feels as deep as the inspiration it heavily lifts from with Saturday morning cartoons, which it does without necessarily elevating, progressing, or even effectively satirizing the notion of, it merely feels like another mediocre fantasy without any backbone, grit, or passion. Except for the art and sound, 10/10 to those guys.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048990302', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1029, 'last_played': 1696577289}
review:
I've played this game up to about the last tier of equipment and about two thirds the campaign, and I can say I mostly love this game. Probably closest in genre to games like Vermintide, but here you play a 80s comic character attempting to tackle the vampire lord Deadalus over nine levels of progressively harder room-by-room dungeon crawling.

The graphics, the voice acting, and even the cartoon intro for the game are perfectly evocative of the era the developers lovingly draw from, while still maintaining a surprisingly deep combat system, with cooldowns, stamina management, ultimate abilities, and a soft rogue-like game loop that will have you revisiting some of the same levels for more gold, more upgrade gems, and more unlock glyphs.

Which leads to the only real complaints one might have of the game - that you could easily want more episodes to play. Right now the path to a "full build" requires millions of gold and possibly hundreds of gems. While progression early on feels very good, the late game gets a little bit grindy. Hopefully the company is planning more episodes to come.

For $30, I felt like I got exactly what I wanted - a love letter to my childhood coupled with a game I could sink a hundred hours into. As a bonus, the company seems particularly checked-in with responding to the game's playerbase and is rolling out patches quickly as bugs are discovered. If you're in the mood for a hack and slash game with rogue-like elements, and the idea of a villain cheesily hamming it up from a balcony before letting his minions take care of you fills you with delight, then this game is for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021997877', 'num_games_owned': 866, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1695456403}
review:
Overall: gorgeous visual style with a game that needs to be thoroughly reworked. I bought it once and returned it, but promised friends I would try it with them. At first glance, the visuals promise a colorful, exciting cartoon adventure but the experience is boring and bland.

Stamina: the game would be better if the stamina mechanic were completely removed. All these comments are true at launch, and after their 20% stamina buff. The game forces you to play at a slower pace, making action a tedious wait. I've never been so bored in a battle. The only real way to play is nursing your stamina and kiting enemies if you are a melee hero. If you run out of stamina you can't run, fight, block, etc. so if you aren't watching your stamina then prepare for a self-induced stun-lock of exhaustion. At higher difficulties, exhaustion is a death sentence. The way stamina is treated would be bad enough as is, but if one weighs the stamina economy against the damage you can do, Prepare to need 3-4 critical headshots with the archer to take down a generic grunt, multiply that by the a couple enemies each wave and a couple waves per room and you realize you just spent 30 minutes waiting to kill an enemy. If you saw combat from the trailer, you might think that combat was exciting - I don't believe they would have sold a single copy if they left a complete engagement in the video instead of a quick clash.

Characters: the heroes are distinct, their skills all kind of overlap in use just because there's so little dynamism to combat. The melee characters are much higher risk, ranged characters are clearly the safer choice,

Dungeons: repetitive, simplistic tiles with little functional variation. You'll clear a mob of enemies only to have another wave drop in on you. Sometimes enemies get stuck at entrances and you have to hunt them down.

Sound: I would return the game over how poorly the sound is implemented. Enemy footsteps get quiet the further away they are, but at a rate that means I don't think the game plays the sound cue if they're out of melee range. The music is samey and repetitive (you can easily hear were the loops are). Spatial sound like Dolby Atmos really struggles to make the sound mean anything. This game is the audio equivalent of a grey smear of noise. 

Features: I returned this game once already because it doesn't have ultrawide support and even had limited 16:9 support.

review: I love it!   It is such a great game and that it is based on an 80`s cartoon.  It fun to play alone and with friends.  Each chapter has lots of different types of enemies.  My favorite weapon is the Thunderbook, it is very satisfying to target and electrify a bunch of enemies.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119512210', 'num_games_owned': 71, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 26, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1712343285}
review:
I would recommend this game if you love the old 80’s style cartoons, gameplay like vermenite, have at least one friend to play with and get this game on a sale.

The game is far from perfect with bugs but they are not game breaking. It does ,however, feel like an early access game and not a finished product. 

The gameplay does feel repetitive but it’s a roguelite with simple combat. If you’re expecting souls-like combat than you will be very disappointed.

Conclusion: Game is fun to mess around with for a 10-20 hours with friends. Especially ones who grew up in the 80s. Combat is simple with bugs, artwork is excellent.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980085639', 'num_games_owned': 674, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1695576921}
review: Had my eye on this one since it showed up on other platforms, glad to see it's here. Been really enjoying it so far, the 80s aesthetic is point and the music is just as synthy and power ballady as I was hoping for. The gameplay's been solid thus far, taking a lot of cues from Hades, and that style of random perk'n'upgrade character building is a great combination with co-op. Coordinating builds with other players during a run was something I didn't know this type of game needed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011992305', 'num_games_owned': 111, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1710939040}

author: {'steamid': '76561198095392124', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1695153373}
review:
Met de 80s intro en looks kreeg ik instant flashbacks naar de bekende tekenfilms uit mijn jeugd, wat een fantastische eerste indruk achter liet.

De set-up van het spel is eenvoudig te begrijpen, ook voor de mensen die niet bekend zijn met dit type spellen. Je kiest een karakter met zijn eigen skills en abilities en je hakt of schiet je een weg door de verschillende dungeons/levels op weg naar de eindbaas. Deze abilities worden niet helemaal duidelijk uitgelegd, dus het is even uitvinden wat alles precies doet. Tijdens de dungeons krijg je loot en perks die jouw karakter sterker kunnen maken of het leven net een beetje makkelijker. 

Tot zo ver het eenvoudige gedeelte van het spel, want de levels blijken naar mate je verder komt steeds uitdagender met vijanden die jou belagen uit alle hoeken. En speel je dit spel met vrienden dan kan je niet te gretig zijn met het oppakken van healthpotions, want deze zijn schaars en voor iedereen hard nodig. In de Citadel kan je jouw perks, skills en wapens upgraden, maar op het eerste oog een lijkt een flinke grind nodig te zijn om jouw held echt sterk te krijgen.

Dit vooruitzicht op eindeloze grinds door de dungeons, hoe uitdagend en afwisselend ze ook kunnen zijn, maakt dat ik mijzelf dit niet uren of dagenlang zie spelen. Wel denk ik dat het spel heel geschikt is voor een gezellige game avond met vrienden.
Al met al dus een leuk vormgegeven spel waar je eenvoudig in stapt, maar ik vraag me af of deze eigenschappen genoeg zijn voor het spel om het hoofd boven water te houden in een zee vol grote titels in dit genre.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098540347', 'num_games_owned': 720, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2087, 'last_played': 1701102615}
review:
(Revised after patch 1.0.3.0.) 
Still 2/10 - Do not buy. 

Still no matchmaking: Online is still unplayable if you're not host, and clicking 'Quick Play' still puts you in a random quest. An "improvement" to Multiplayer added the ability to chose a difficultly when clicking Quick Play, so now you can chose a random Easy, Normal or Hard game and suffer 900 ping, or chose Mythical I, II, III, and find no games at all. 

Upgrades are still MASSIVELY overpriced: 5 weapons, 23 Perks, 30 Trinkets and 18 Constellation slots all with 4 tiers to upgrade, plus 1 million gold worth of skins and voice lines, etc. To obtain 1 million Gold, it takes hours and hours of grinding, and maxing your Constellation by converting Rare Shards would cost over 50M Gold. Do the math.

After 40+ hours of grinding I am barely half way to "maxing" 1 of the 4 character's. Yet you can see everything the game has to offer and complete the whole story in just a few. 

All costs need to be reduced by 75% - 80%. All difficulties should unlock after completing the story on any difficulty. Shards and Gold should be shared between characters.
The game NEEDS a lobby where we can search for games that are available, see Ping, Quest, difficulty and characters in game.

I genuinely tried to like this game, but I still cannot.
developer_response: We appreciate your review and already have implemented your feedback into the game. Check out the recently released patch, and give MythForce another try!

author: {'steamid': '76561197989317695', 'num_games_owned': 2823, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 975, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 431, 'last_played': 1699928933}
review:
I'm seeing a lot of bad reviews with really low play times. (less than an hour)
Several of those reviews point out that you lose all progress between missions. That's simply not true. This is a roguelite. There's both in-mission progression that only lasts through the current mission, and there's permanent progression that carries over between missions.

The in-level progression consists of a variety of pickups/buffs that improve your weapons, skills, and grant special passive effects. The pickups have 4 tiers of quality, but you will need to improve your permanent progression in order to get the higher tier upgrades. 

As stated, the permanent progression increases your chances of finding higher tier upgrades during a mission. Additionally, you can improve your damage, your resistances, your speed, etc. You can also unlock cosmetic stuff in the permanent progression system like new outfits, emotes, and voice lines for the characters.

There are currently 9 missions, but each mission has several levels of difficulty. (some of which need to be unlocked) The missions are procedurally generated. It seems that the first 3 missions are a bit lacking in variety, but the other 6 seem to be way better. This might change on harder difficulties. (I haven't made enough progression to do those yet)

Though it seems somewhat weird, the characters can mix things up by equipping a small variety of weapon sets. (rogues can equip spell books, mages can equip melee weapons) However, you can only take two sets with you per mission. You can also upgrade these weapon sets with permanent progression.

Though there are complaints that the devs didn't listen to anything during EA, they did make a few significant changes that were especially helpful. I think that they really dropped the ball on tutorials, but if you've played similar games (Gunfire Reborn, RoboQuest) it shouldn't take you long to pick up.

There's also complaints of a lack of content. There are only 9 levels and 4 heroes at the moment, but it sounds like the devs plan to continue adding to the game over time.

No one that I've played with has had any performance complaints. No crashes. No in-game glitches that have interrupted play. There is a weird visual glitch for some folks that looks like there's a dirt overlay on the screen. A workaround is to set your graphics settings to the LOW profile, (this disables the overlay) then drag the quality sliders where you want them. (devs have stated that they are working on a fix for this as of this review)

I recommend the game, but I'm a bit hesitant at the $30 price tag. I'd absolutely buy it again at $30, but I feel that some folks might not feel that there's enough content to be worth it at that price. The Humble Bundle Store currently has a deal for 50% off of a 4 pack, which comes out to $15 a person. At that price, I 100% recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198145302220', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 991, 'last_played': 1705893387}
review:
Mythforce: Fun, if a little flawed.

I've very much enjoyed this game, especially with friends. The perks feel impactful, the meta-progression feels VERY impactful, and the general tome of the game is very fun. 

The soundtrack is excellent, and a lot of the visuals are both clear and visually pleasing.

What I mean by this is that it resembles (obviously) the aesthetics of an 80's cartoon. The way they outlined interactive objects, enemies, and allies makes them look like figures on a backdrop. This help you distinguish very quickly and easily between what's important and what is not.

There ARE a few drawbacks: 

1. Bugs. Not anything gamebreaking so far (16ish hours in), just a few minor bugs. Inability to access some shrines and such (fixed by switching weapons or using an ability), fell through the floor once (my movement ability returned me to the map). So, nothing GIANT, but enough to notice, and be annoyed by.

2. Lack of labeling of the hub areas building. I've played with several friends, and it seems counter-intuitive that we can click on the buildings in the background city (at first). 

3. Why is my party option automatically set to public? I don't want strangers joining my game. Without some kind of ingame chat, it feels highly impersonal and awkward. 'Friends only would be a much better option in my opinion.


Those three items comprise my main complaints. None of them are deal-breakers, and they all seem like things that can be relatively easy fixes (I understand how complicated fixing bugs can get, but this is already in a better state than, say, the average Bethesda game). Also, they've already dropped a hot fix patch to fix some of the bugs, and that's a good sign.

Overall, I highly recommend this game, especially with friends. Plenty of value here for the price!

Hey, thanks a lot for your review. It helped improve the game and make it better.

We've just released a massive QoL update that fixed a lot of issues. Check it out and let us know about your experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561197967626603', 'num_games_owned': 684, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 541, 'last_played': 1705179930}
review:
Edit: 15/12/23

The game today received a combat update and it plays SO much more fluidly :) I'm so pleased that this game is getting better, i'd love to see it expanded on. Kudos to Beamdog, the game has improved by a large margin in only a few months. THEY'RE ACTUALLY DOING IT GUYS!

-- -- --

Edit 10/12/23:

The issue noted below with hit registration with magical attacks seems to have been largely resolved! Please disregard that below as it seems fixed :)

-- -- -- 

Mythforce is a great little title, with a hopefully bright future ahead of it.

It's a co-op roguelike with a cracking art style. I often see 'melee focused' mentioned when talking about this, but I think that depends on what character you play as, as of the four currently in the game  two are melee, and two are ranged focused.

You journey through 3 sets of  levels in each biome, of which there are 3 with a selection of secrets smattered through, and a boss/horde/special encounter at the end. It starts slow as the first sort of half of the game is very easy, but once the enemies start displaying some slightly different behavior the game becomes A LOT of fun, especially with a friend or two in tow.

Progression is drawn out nicely, without being too long to feel unrewarding, and the weapons feel decent. 

There are some hit registration issues however currently particularly with the mage character, which has been identified as a netcode issue and is expected to be rectified shortly. This issue does not seem to exist when soloing, or if whoever plays mage is hosting the session though.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994175369', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5808, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2033, 'last_played': 1696628511}
review:
This game is good times!

I was initially leery of grabbing it due to mixed reviews, but I quickly picked up on the fact that if you sort by "hours played" anything over 1 hour was "overwhelmingly positive". Folks either bounce off the 80s cartoon vibe and don't get it, or they stay and really enjoy it for what it is. I happened to be one of the latter.

The premise is straightforward—you can play solo or as a part of a colorful fantasy team of warriors (very Masters of the Universe) that defend the land of Eldryth. The game this reminds me most of is something like Vermintide, but instead of static maps it has procedurally generated dungeons assembled from a rooms themed by chapter with usually a midpoint miniboss and a final bigger encounter. Every 3 "episodes" (aka levels) or so you fight one of the Big Bosses who usually give you some cheesy dialogue about how you'll never defeat them and backstory (like who they are rivals with etc).

It is a roguelite (something like Hades) where the runs take between 20 mins for earlier episodes, and maybe 40-50 minutes for the later ones. This means you have to restart your build each episode (level) and have some ways to boost your starting stuff or what's accessible to build from between each outing.

Network connectivity was straightforward (it uses peer-to-peer and I had no lag with my friends even though some of us are hundreds of miles away). They really nailed the graphics and I love the voice acting. The cartoons they have for each chapter are fantastic, and I love the music.

At first the game felt a bit simplistic, but that's mostly playing on normal. The AI seems rudimentary, and there isn't a ton of nuance obvious. But every time you beat a level you can play one difficulty higher. And mythic is no joke. You're quickly learning to watch for those incoming attack prompts, keep an eye on archers to dodge as they fire, and those rudimentary AIs become a whole lot more threatening when you can't drop them in 2-3 easy swings and you have to kite one and use cover to regenerate enough stamina to get a charge and big hit in on the archer sniping you. Suddenly whether your power attack will knock something down, or where you're hitting with that attack (back, head, body) becomes a bit more important.

So I'd say it's great for some casual players who want to soak up some vibes and dialogue, and spend 20-30 hours with friends just goofing off and having a good time, but you can definitely crank it up and challenge yourself a bit. There's even some advanced progression and  some resource grind for folks that want to get absolutely everything. The first group will enjoy those hand-painted backgrounds in the crypt levels, and finding secret passages, and hidden treasure, and the second will appreciate the difference in split second management of heavy vs light attacks, perfect blocks, and your friend who can land those headshots for crits over your shoulder.

If I have one complaint it's that I would love more episodes and characters. But for a small indie studio, and a $30 game, this is about right. If they have DLC planned, they have me and my crew's money for sure.

All in all, I greatly recommend the game. I'm a big fan of those old timey cartoons and I love the vibes they put into this, so me and my friends are sort of dead center of their target audience. Give it a go. If the reviews are any indication, you should know within the first hour or so if it's for you. ^_~ Hope to see you in Eldryth!

author: {'steamid': '76561198026654612', 'num_games_owned': 536, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1694589835}
review:
Oczekiwałem po niej wiele, niestety zwróciłem bo nie jest to czego oczekiwałem. Liczyłem na sporo więcej zawartości, a mam wrażenie jakbym grał... w grę we wczesnym dostępie. I to za 125 zł. 
Pomysł był naprawdę genialny, bo połączenie stylistyki starej kreskówki z tym gatunkiem i widokiem z pierwszej osoby był niejako powiewem świeżości, ale do wykonania niestety można się bardzo przyczepić. 
Menu, "tutorial", zawartość wygląda naprawdę jakby gra była dopiero w swojej początkowej fazie, co jak na produkt który już miał swoją premierę jest bardzo zastanawiające. Może jak kiedyś wprowadzą zmiany, jakąś większą zawartość (na ten moment jedyne co możesz robić, to grindować walutę i ulepszać umiejki) i popracują nad gameplayem to coś z tego wyjdzie.
Bo naprawdę, jak rogaliki potrafią do monitora przyciągnąć na dłuższy czas, tak tutaj musiałbym naprawdę się męczyć by ugrać dłuższą sesję. Są lepsze propozycje z tego gatunku.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000506549', 'num_games_owned': 678, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 349, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1695007025}
review:
The core gameplay is promising but it's lacking in content. My experience in Vermintide 2 is carrying over well.

Most characters have an average of 6~ weapons each and of those weapons there are only about 4 different weapon types. I appreciate opening up the weapon selection so you can really focus on what gameplay you like. 

The characters and abilities diversify then from each other really well and I appreciate that, like the weapons, you aren't locked out certain characters because your teammates are playing as them too.

I'm looking forward to where the game goes from here. For now what I'd like to see are longer more challanging missions. Maybe some kind of holdout mode.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170045659', 'num_games_owned': 547, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 667, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 365, 'last_played': 1695223893}
review:
80'lerin popüler çizgi roman veya çizgi filmlerini andıran grafiklere sahip bir oyun. Örnek olarak He-man tarzı. Grafikleri  kendine has olduğu için belki ilk başta size farklı gelebilir fakat temasına gayet uygundur. 

Oyun ister tek kişi ister 4 kişiye kadar oynayabileceğiniz bir yapıya sahip. Bir harita üzerinde doğrusal olarak ilerleyen bölümlere sahip. Siz bölümleri bitirdikçe bir sonraki bölüm açılıyor ve her bölümün girmek istediğiniz zorluğunu siz seçiyorsunuz. Mythic zorluklar için öncesinde o bölümdeki bir alt kademedeki zorluğu bitirmeniz gerek. Ne kadar yüksek zorluk olursa o kadar çok kazanç oluyor. Bölümler ise oda oda ilerliyor, yani bir kısıma girdiniz bir grup yaratığı kestiniz sonrasında diğer odaya girmeden önce ödülü alıyorsunuz ve devam ediyorsunuz. Her seferinde canavar olmuyor bazen dükkan bazen hazine alanları gibi yerlerde mevcut ve aynı bölümü tekrar oynadığınızda aynı şekilde ilerlemiyor her seferinde farklı bir düzende geliyor karşınıza.

Az önce bahsettiğim kısımda diğer odalara geçmeden ödül alma kısmı ise 2 çeşit bir tanesi silahlarınıza ait geliştirmeler diğeri ise karaktere ait geliştirmeler. Örnek vermek gerekirse, ilkinde silahınıza ateş hasarı ekleme veya vuruşlarda harcadığı manayı azaltma gibi şeyler çıkarken ikincisinde karakterinizin maks canını arttırma veya daha hızlı hareket etmesini sağlama benzeri şeyler çıkıyor.
Aynı zamanda oyunda açtığınız sandıklardan veya kestiğiniz yaratıklardan item düşebiliyor. Bunlarda yine sizi güçlendirmeye yarayan şeyler kalıcı değiller her bölümde ne düşerse onu kullanabiliyorsunuz sadece.

4 adet oynanabilir karakter mevcut belki ilerde sayısı artabilir. klasik olarak gidersek savaşçı, okcu, büyücü ve rogue. Her birinin kendine has güzel yetenekleri mevcut. Ek olarak her karakter yanında 2 adet silah taşıyabiliyor bunlar arasında istediniz zaman geçiş yaparak ağır ve ya normal saldırılar gerçekleştirebiliyorsunuz.

Oyunda bir de hideout diyebileceğimiz bir bölge var burası oyuna ilk başladığınız zaman yıkık dökük olan bir yer. Siz oyun içinde ilerledikçe çıkardığınız materyaller ile geliştirdiğiniz bir alan. Bu bölgeyi ne kadar çok geliştirirseniz siz de bir o kadar gelişiyorsunuz çünkü kalıcı olarak silahlarını güçlendirme, aldığınız perklerin ve çıkan itemlerin tierini arttırma alanları mevcut. Sun Disk olarak geçen binanın geliştirmesini yaptıkça içindeki "constellation" kısmında yeni alanlar açılıyor ve oraya koyduğunuz gemler sayesinde direkt olarak statlarınızı arttırabiliyorsunuz. Gemlerin kademesine göre verdiği statlarda değişiyor.

Oyun genel olarak bunlardan ibaret, yeni çıktığı için şuan pek fazla bir içerik yok gibi görünüyor fakat ilerleyen zamanda yeni  bölümler karakterler ekstra içerikler gelecektir. Ufak tefek problemler vardı onları da düzelttiler. Yenisi oldukça ilgileceneklerdir. Oyuna bir şans vermenizi isterim, ister tek ister arkadaşlarınızla keyif alarak oynayacağınızı düşünüyorum. Fiyatı biraz pahalı olabilir indirim beklenebilir almak için.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960364629', 'num_games_owned': 4356, 'num_reviews': 292, 'playtime_forever': 284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 14, 'playtime_at_review': 284, 'last_played': 1712286331}
review:
[h1]80's Nostalgia = +100% but Game Play is lacking = -50%[/h1]

As a person that grew up in the late 70's and 80's with He-Man, Thundercats, Sliverhawks and Bionic Six and so on and so on and or like many other Saturday Morning Cartoons from the era and for games of the time as in Dragon's Lair at the arcades, the animation and looks are on point. Even the music is on point and stays true to the 80's cartoon theme. But the game feels like is missing something and can very repetitive. The controls feel a bit sluggish and slow at times. I do think the DMG is a bit off also being solo its fine depending on what you set it too but in Multi its a bit easy at times and sometimes when peeps lvl or lvl up, you are just standing there being they are killing all in sight lol 

Truth, I feel this would have made an amazing story based FPS game with Co-Op just for the looks alone instead of a Gunfire Reborn type of game. So, this isn't a bad game or a great game but it is nice looking and a bit fun if you don't mind the repetitiveness of it. Truth, I really like it just for single player. More so if you love or grew up watching 80's Saturday Morning Cartoons. 

So, for the Nostalgia ride, I dig it!!

author: {'steamid': '76561197967085147', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1700688171}
review:
Written after Hotfix 1 released:

I'm sorry to write that, in its current state, it's practically unplayable if you're not the host of the lobby. Even with - according to the UI - a full strength connection, there were issues with:

* Victoria's shield throw not returning
* being unable to attack
* being unable to open chests
* being unable to switch weapons
* being unable to activate abilities
* getting stuck in the environment

Gameplay wise - it's fine. Nothing special, but a fun FPS rouge-like that is good to play while on a voice chat with the friends you [i]definitely[/i] have.

Looking forward to seeing how it develops - I can imagine the game being great with more time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071189687', 'num_games_owned': 352, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 511, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 511, 'last_played': 1694900147}
review: This game definitely has potential. The core gameplay is fun, though repetitive at times. The art and music in this game is phenomenal, and the intro video is one of the best intros I've ever seen to a videogame. The solo player experience is alright; this game really shines in multiplayer. But be forewarned,  the matchmaking in this game is a little lousy; you can either do Quickplay that puts you in a random level with other players, or you can host an Open Lobby which very rarely ever sees other players join. I really hope to see this game grow.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017084481', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 97, 'last_played': 1695432090}
review:
Art Style - Reminds me of The Banner Saga fully animated. It feels really unique and the characters & enemies do too.

Combat - Think Vermintide 2 basic style. It feels a little more fine-tuned than Vermintide's, imo. Everyone's starting weapons and load outs are all fairly similar except the mage. But save up some gold from your runs and you can quickly customize each character. Gold (Money to upgrade your guy) is tied to your individual character; not the account (if this matters to you; I sort of like it).

I do wish the combat animations were a little bit more fleshed out. I felt like there were frames of the animation that were missing at times, creating added difficulty when attempting a parry. I think this is stuff that will get more fleshed out the more player feedback they receive, 

I will continue to update the review as I play more, but these are just my initial thoughts.  It's a lot of fun so far.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018759231', 'num_games_owned': 3828, 'num_reviews': 512, 'playtime_forever': 569, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1694990367}
review:
[h1]Fun co-op rogue lite with gorgeous cartoony graphics and art style.[/h1]

The combat while not better than the Vermintide games is still engaging and interesting.
Level design is decent sadly the procedural generation is a bit disappointing, only four or less hours into the game and we can already spot repeats for the level layouts.
There is four different classes each with their own abilities to ensure good replayability.
The game can be played in co-op but is also perfectly playable solo.

Honestly MythForce is a very competent game, it's far from perfect but it is well worth checking out if you enjoy dungeon crawling with rogue lite elements.

[h1]Rating 7/10.[/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561197983190707', 'num_games_owned': 345, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 682, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1704069121}
review: Mythforce macht viel Spaß und erinnert sofort mit seinem Grafikstil an alte 80er Kultzeichentrickserien wie He-Man.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993323698', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 1818, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1696125274}
review: If you have a few friends to play with, Mythforce is fun and thematic. We play a lot of things like Left 4 Dead and Vermintide and Mythforce definitely brings a unique blend of the First person coop genre with rogue like elements. At times its a little bit janky and buggy, but we haven't encountered anything game breaking. It is definitely worth the price of admission.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977197672', 'num_games_owned': 806, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1695089841}
review:
It's so fun solo. I have no idea how but I ended up picking up some randos along the way and THAT was a blast too!

Basically... for me? The best parts of Left 4 Dead combine with my love of all things cartoon, classic heavy metal, and compelling gameplay that strives to "feel good" rather than be overly complicated or add gimmicky mechanics to stand out.  The game stands out for all the right reasons: great look, great sound, great characters.  Easy feels like a stomp.  Normal presents an ok challenge solo but should be very manageable with co-op friends, and "hard" is well.. hard.  Having true difficulty levels that are appropriate (for me and my skill level anyway) is a nice touch!

author: {'steamid': '76561198971438452', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 686, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 686, 'last_played': 1694869854}
review:
The graphics style reminds of the cartoons I wasn't allowed to watch as a kid, and the game is fun and easy to get into.
It's much easier with friends, because you can revive each other when one dies, but it is playable in single player as well, especially if you get a bit lucky with drops (healing potions) and perks that boost health.
I have only played as Maggie and Victoria so far and liked them both. 
If you like randomized loot and perks, this is fun. If you mind dying often, this will be frustrating.

I have some trouble with motion sickness especially in the levels with narrow rooms where the walls are close, but sitting far enough from the screen helps.

It's a family game too, my son is 12 and had more fun with it than I do, so we might need to get another copy for his Switch so that we can play it together.

Roguelite is not exactly my favourite genre, I prefer RPGs, but for "in between" as some relaxing quick fun with friends or family, it's nice.

author: {'steamid': '76561198354001304', 'num_games_owned': 227, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 396, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 294, 'last_played': 1699745605}
review: Dieses Game ist nach meiner Meinung zum Zeit verbringen oder einfach mal abzuschalten absolut nice. Die lvl sind anspruchsvoll und gut gemacht. Die Gegner arten sind auch sehr interessant und durchaus anspruchsvoll. Das lvl Systeme sowohl auch Perks sind mega und durchaus komplex denn Zeitweise muss man mal doppelt darüberleasen. Ich gebe den Spiel eine 9/10 und empfehle es gerne weiter. Absolut gut gemacht sehr geehrten Entwickler

author: {'steamid': '76561198118888916', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 300, 'last_played': 1696735808}
review:
Pretty fun cartoon rogueish game. I played it with my kids around and let them have a go also, they enjoyed it and want to keep playing. 
Enjoyed the fact that kids can play this and focus on having fun without worrying that there is gore or uncomfortable parts. 

We noticed some repetitive environments and it’s more fun multiplayer but enjoyed the challenge of different stages and we will be back for more. 
Ranged heroes are more fun and seem to do more damage, items are limited and we hope to see this expanded on soon.
