review: 游戏不咋地，BUG一大堆，构筑也没有很多差别，发售108买的，早起93，我只想说游戏真垃圾，恶心人

author: {'steamid': '76561197964839168', 'num_games_owned': 203, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 448, 'last_played': 1696223041}
review:
I like this 80s cartoon Joel Haver fever game, but it's got issues. Issues that ultimately prevent me from recommending the game as of its current state.

Multiplayer suffers a bulk of the issues. The game is peer-to-peer, but this game’s P2P is unstable all the time. I play other P2P games with my friends and those games are nowhere near this game’s instability. Perk/Smith shrines bug out for non-host players, mobs stutter about making range attacks difficult to lead and land, you’re never sure how close a mob actually is before it's too late to evade, the lobby can just suddenly break down and you can only invite half of your group back for whatever reason. 

The roguelike aspect of the game is a bit too grindy. After every run you get these glyphs that can be used to upgrade your town’s facilities. Armory (makes your starter gear stronger), constellation (allows you to slot gems and increase your base stats), emporium (allows you to find higher tier versions of trinkets), and conclave (allows you the ability to acquire a higher tier version of perks.) The amount of glyphs you get on the available difficulty is chump change after that first upgrade. My point being; expect to only get tier 2 of glass cannon for the longest eternity from biome 1 to 3 and still waiting in ng+. 

Melee combat feels uncomfortable, weak, and risky . Range is just the best of all worlds, even with the latency issue. When trying to switch to your off-hand or vice versa the game will eat the input, and it does this often. There are not enough variant tile sets per biome. You could easily see the same long center staircase leading into a big rectangle room four times in the same 40 minute run. The mob variety basically comes to an end at biome 2 of 3. The bosses of each biome are set, meaning there is only one. Dollar tree He-man monster, Hextar the necromage, and Deadaless the vampire BBEG. That is it. 

I enjoy parts of the game but I just cannot recommend it in its current state. I might play a little more with my friends if they wish to dive back into this lumpy pool. I know some of you won't understand and would want to reply with “Well if you thought it was d**s*** why are you still playing, huh? HAHA GOTTEM!” I never said it was any type of poop, and the point of a review is; to help others make a better buying decision, to share my experiences, and to let the developer/publisher know how I as a paying customer of their product feel.
developer_response:
Hey! We've implemented your feedback into the game! We've released a massive QoL update that fixed a ton of issuea, especially regarding Multiplayer. Check it out and let us know about your gaming experience.

https://store.steampowered.com/news/app/363860/view/5912724862977977688

author: {'steamid': '76561198078889483', 'num_games_owned': 271, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1694837494}
review: Epic Online Services
developer_response:
Hello! 

The game doesn't require you to install the EGS launcher. It doesn't boot through Epic. It needs to install Epic Online Services that are needed for us to provide cloud saving, matchmaking etc.

Many well-known games use EOS such as Hades and Risk of Rain 2, or Disco Elysium.

https://steamdb.info/tech/SDK/EpicOnlineServices/

Read more about EOS here: https://dev.epicgames.com/docs/epic-online-services

author: {'steamid': '76561197962930443', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 113, 'last_played': 1694832053}
review: Mythforce is an entertaining experience which reminds me of games like Gauntlet. The art style nails the 80s cartoon vibe. I absolutely loved the intro sequence. The game is definitely more enjoyable with friends rather than playing solo but you'll find fun either way.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995174942', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1694918738}
review:
Co-Op Hack'n'slash a la Warhammer Vermintide.  Captures the intended aesthetic pretty well, even if I get the sense that there's still some polish left to put on.  The gameplay loop is fun, and the styling is pretty awesome, but there are definitely some small cracks in the facade.

Decent class/character variety and a fair amount of progression opportunity available.  It's fun, but less so as a solo player.  Ingame chat options seem pretty limited, so hop on a voice call.

Overall a fun game, but I would be hoping to see some eventual updates, like more nodes for map generation (haven't we been here before?), or better ingame help (what is that "corruption" effect doing?), or improved ability to interact with teammates (I can't say 'Thank you'?).

author: {'steamid': '76561197970649200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 1227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 539, 'last_played': 1700554984}
review: It's got a vibe and the developers are responsive.  This is all one needs to know, unless they need to know more, in which case I don't have any more so read another review thank you so much

author: {'steamid': '76561198042027619', 'num_games_owned': 459, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 2625, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1906, 'last_played': 1704506434}
review:
It's good! 
There are some bugs here and there, some of them quite annoying, others make it impossible to play.
And some bugs that feel like features, and actually improve on the game in some ways.

So far I've solo cleared Mythic 3 as Victoria.
I don't like how currency is handled as a character-to-character basis instead of account-wide. And matchmaking is pretty bad.

But definitely holds quite a lot of potential. If you're a Vermintide veteran looking for another way to scratch that "itch" like me, it might be worth keeping an eye on and looking out for future updates. Personally, I enjoy it, but its pace is a lot slower, similar to Dark and Darker.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998921626', 'num_games_owned': 1890, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1694911059}
review:
I love Mythforce's cartoon aesthetic.  The game is fairly good in single-player, but I can see how it would absolutely shine for couch co-op.

The gameplay itself is smooth as butter, the enemies are challenging and move & feel like they have mass to them.  Same with the melee weapons.  I'm not sold on the moving from room to room & clearing it, but I guess that's pretty common for action roguelikes.

I know people generally don't play these kind of games for the story, but the actual storyline could use some fleshing out.  I'm not sure why I'm fighting all of these minions or where the mushroom folk are coming from.

My only real complaint is no sense of character progression between "episodes".  I think Hades spoiled me on that.

All in all, it's a decent action game & I can wait to give it a shot with my kids. 7.5 / 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198004369747', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 18311, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 91, 'playtime_at_review': 149, 'last_played': 1712281922}
review:
A pretty fun melee oriented FPS, but also has ranged combat with magic.  This game improves on Vermintide's combat by having less m1 spam.  You can perform different attacks with different effects, and energy costs.

For example a sprint attack knocks enemies over, where you can execute them.  Any hit on a grounded foe does critical damage.  This reminds me of Dark Messiah, where you could use the same strategy.  Power attacks can knock enemies out of their attack animations, and light attacks are quick and easy to get away with.  There is also a perfect parry/block/dodge system, where timing these actions gets greater results.  A perfect parry grants a free riposte.  A perfect block knocks giant foes to their knees.  A perfect dodge avoids all damage, even if you were hit.

The game has a stamina system like a Souls-like.  This makes combat deliberate, and you must have a plan before attacking.  You can also customize your character to have almost unlimited stamina, if this is something you don't want to deal with.

The game features full character stat customization, allowing you to stack health, armor, damage, attack speed, stamina, or cooldowns.  Mages can be tanky, if they choose.  You also can equip a lot of weapons on different characters.  The hunter and rogue can use magic, if they choose.

Finally, the game features 5 unique abilities to each character.  All characters share overdrive, then each character gets a jump ability, a utility ability, a combat ability, and an ultimate ability.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993358016', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1014, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 971, 'last_played': 1695168236}

author: {'steamid': '76561198097022148', 'num_games_owned': 216, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 216, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1694958517}
review:
As many other people here have already said, it feels unfinished.
My major critique is honestly the hit-feedback and lack of variety and the progression system. I dont feel the oomph that I so crave when I hit someone with my mace or melee weapon in general.

and also, I was picking a modifier for my blink as the mage, and by the time I had FINALLY read through all the options and had picked one, i got hit multiple times before I was able to actually move. I should gain control right as I make that decision, not with 1-1.5 second delay
Those are my first impressions though, for the minute it's hard to recommend. Like I said it feels largely unfinished, in my first run I fell through the floor just walking regularly in a room and couldnt find a way to "reset" my characters position, so I walked to the edge of the map and was defeated when jumping off of the edge.
developer_response:
Hi! Thanks a lot for your review. It helped improve the game and make it better.

We've just released a massive QoL update that fixed a lot of issues, including Multiplayer. Check it out and let us know about your gaming experience.

On top of the improvements we’ve already added to 1.0.3.0, the next patch will focus on even greater improvements in your moment-to-moment combat experience focusing on responsiveness, combat flow, and improving the functionality of your abilities.

https://store.steampowered.com/news/app/363860/view/5912724862977977688

author: {'steamid': '76561198007290300', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 292, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 292, 'last_played': 1687279037}
review:
Fun little game! 

Mythforce is my first game in this genre. I normally play very little MP but I found this game to be fairly fun in multiplayer. I tried it solo too but that wasn't as much fun of course. The artwork is stellar! For older peeps like myself who did indeed grow up with the cartoons this game draw inspiration from, I salut their effort. It feels unique and fresh, which is funny considering it's a 40 year old style. 

Overall I think the game needs some more polish. The controls could be tighter, the classes and skills more interesting, but I hope they build on this and maybe add-on more later with DLCs. It has the base to become a very fun game and I could imagine it being very fun played "old school" style 4 player sofa MP.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972286953', 'num_games_owned': 347, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1477, 'last_played': 1700686576}
review:
There's a lot to enjoy here, and a lot of potential in the game for more enjoyment going forward. The aesthetic is fantastic and hits an amazing point of nostalgia, but it definitely covers up some slower, somewhat repetitive gameplay especially once you get to the higher difficulty tiers. Even at Mythic I, I spent as much time just running from enemies while my stamina slowly recovered, turned, landed a hit, then went back to scurrying because the enemy HP outscales your ability to damage it so quickly when you start out a level. 
That drawback being said, I still enjoy the game and plan to put more time into it. I feel like I am chasing a dragon for a good build though, and there are no dragons - currently the levels feel too short to put together a truly overpowered build and putting together a truly overpowered build is one of the hallmarks of the roguelike/lite genre. 
So far, each time I finish a floor, I walk through the exit feeling like my build is just barely about to start coming together, without the change to really use that build before I start the next floor and I start out at zero again.
A mode where you can chain floors together so you can put together more of a build would be a fantastic add (though given the pre-release was 3 floors chained and they removed that, I feel that isn't the direction they are going). 
Still, for a good bit of Saturday Morning Nostalgia with some friends, you could definitely do worse.

Edit: Coming back after I have finished all achievements, including Deadalus on Mythic 3, I can say they are still improving this game. There is still a lot of fun to have here, and having put this much time into it, I think I can safely say it is worth the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198322516618', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1696665074}
review: I haven't play much but I already love it so much! I come from Vermintide 2 and I like these coop mechanics

author: {'steamid': '76561198032158435', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 122, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 122, 'last_played': 1694775622}
review:
Been playing Mythforce demo with friends before and now played the full game a bit I can say it's a really fun and relaxing game.

I was always a fan of cartoons from the 80's, like Masters of Universe. Mythforce definitely touch a serious nostalgic tunes in me, which I absolutely love. I haven't realised, how much I need to run around a cartoonish environment and shoot some monsters. That was relaxing, especially with friends (and I'm a solo player by heart).

If I'd have to name one thing that is a bit weird, it's the fact that the game reqires Epic Online Services, which is a bit confusing, because it looked for a second, as if it required Epic launcher to boot. Other, than that, I love it and can recommend it to anyone who wants to have fun, shooting bad guys with a group of friends!

author: {'steamid': '76561198045523656', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 228, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 228, 'last_played': 1645043885}

author: {'steamid': '76561198420100631', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 236, 'last_played': 1702650145}
review:
ステージクリア型で気軽に遊べる。
グラフィックも独特で、90年代アメコミが好きだった方、
このノリが大丈夫な人なら楽しめると思います。

私はタートルズが大好きなので、
これでタートルズが題材だったら
本当に最高だったかもしれない。

OPは空前絶後のカッコよさ。

カッコ良すぎる。

気の合う仲間が4人集まれば、暇つぶしに良いと思う。
面白い。

author: {'steamid': '76561197999973079', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 990, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 594, 'last_played': 1694873483}
review:
Wer in den 80ern aufgewachsen ist fühlt sich vom Artstyle und der Musik sofort abgeholt. 
Das Gameplay, vor allem wenn man einen Nahkampfcharakter spielt, bedarf aufgrund des Ausdauersystems etwas Übung und Timing. Die Progression ist verbunden mit sehr viel Grind da Ressourcen wie Edelsteine und Gold einem nicht gerade in Massen hinterher geschmissen wird. 

Alles in allem für mich aber ein absolut solider Titel, der sowohl solo, aber noch viel mehr mit Freunden im Koop ausreichend Spielspaß und Dauer bietet um den Preis zu rechtfertigen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044116627', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 999, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 2, 'playtime_at_review': 818, 'last_played': 1712337595}
review:
Nostalgia Meets Repetition

MythForce's Saturday morning cartoon charm is nostalgic, but the gameplay loop quickly becomes repetitive. While it attempts roguelike elements, it lacks variety.

The challenge mainly stems from unforgiving mechanics, not strategy. Multiplayer progression is lacking, and penalties for player exits can frustrate. Audio gets repetitive.

Character progression is character-specific, not account-wide. MythForce shows potential but feels more like early access. Best enjoyed with a dedicated group.

After Patch -
The game is better with hits registering and things being a lot smoother but that is pretty much it.  Audio seems better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022658341', 'num_games_owned': 61, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 833, 'last_played': 1695464134}
review:
If you like Gunfire Reborn, Risk of Rain,  or similar roguelite/like games, you might like this one too.
Granted this one is a lot slower paced in combat, which isn't necessarily a bad thing.  
You can ramp up the difficulty as you successfully clear the previous difficulty of the episode to make for a challenge and also to "farm" more of the in game shards and glyphs you use to power up your heroes.

The level designs are rather repetitive, and not much change between the tilesets. Each "world" though has different tile sets, so you're not completely playing just the same one over and over. 

If you like grinding to an extent, and mindlessly killing monsters and leveling up your character to be stronger, this might be for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198856357934', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 153, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1694787556}
review: I have been in love with this game since I started playing it. A lot of ppl here rating it badly is just saying that its repetitive but literally what rogue like game isn't? Rogue like games are suppose to be repetitive thats part of their charm. This game nails everything in almost every aspect from the 80s cartoon look they were going for to the voice acting down to the gameplay. Though I do think they got the difficulty for the characters wrong bc they have the magic chick labeled as hard and she was the easiest for me to learn while the ones they marked as easy were actually hard to learn lol. Maybe its just me that don't mind repetitive gameplay bc I been having blast since I started playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198003933380', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1694719073}
review: The game is not good in my brief play time but it got off on a really bad foot when it wanted me to install some Epic Games crap right out of the gate. developer_response:
Hello! The game indeed needs to install Epic Online Services that are required for us to provide cloud saving, matchmaking etc.

Many well-known games use EOS such as Hades and Risk of Rain 2, or Disco Elysium.

https://steamdb.info/tech/SDK/EpicOnlineServices/

See what EOS is here: https://dev.epicgames.com/docs/epic-online-services

author: {'steamid': '76561197991431525', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 88, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88, 'last_played': 1694672711}
review:
Optik von MythForce eine glatte 10/10!

Das Spiel sieht wunderschön aus und gibt mir starke Vibes zurück aus meiner Kindheit.
He-Man, She-Ra und Bravestarr waren damals meine Serien als Bengel und dieser Look
wurde sehr gut getroffen aber....

...nun ja wie soll ich das beschreiben, das Spiel fühlt sich nicht fertig an.
Irgendwie schade aber Gameplay, Menü und die allgemeine Tutorial Führung
fühlt sich nicht richtig an und deshalb muss ich schweren Herzens für keine
Kaufempfehlung aussprechen, eine Neutrale Bewertung kann man ja auf Steam nicht abgeben. 

Keine 2 Stunden gespielt und die Motivation weiter zu spielen ist erstmal nicht vorhanden. 

Crab Champions oder Gunfire Reborn
das sind zwei Spiele mit den ihr alleine oder bis zu vier Spieler wirklich Spaß haben könnt.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978567058', 'num_games_owned': 837, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 456, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1696044340}
review:
This game is in a solid spot in my opinion. Almost all of the concerns I had from the Demo have been improved on, showing me the Developers are listening to the feedback when it is given. The second level is also I would say a step up in terms of the quality of the games design. They made a multitude of positive changes from the Demo to the gearing, upgrading, pacing, and overall feel of the game. 

The graphics of course continue to be it's biggest highlight. Normally this would be a negative as games who focus on graphics usually sacrifice everything else. Mythforce is a special case with its 80's inspired Cartoon style. But the gameplay and pacing has also seen significant improvements as previously mentioned. 

It all makes me eager to see where they go with this game in the future. If they can process this much feedback and actually implement significant changes like this once, I have no reason to think they won't be able to do it again. Which for me means the future of this game is likely bright.

author: {'steamid': '76561198063482345', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 357, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1696422381}
review: Прекрасная игра для тех кто хочет расслабится с друзьями или в одиночестве, без лишнего вникания в различные механики. Выбрал перса, посмотрел скилы и пошел мочить монстров. Проще не придумаешь. Если Вы хотите глубокое рпг, с сюжетом, прокачкой и т.д., то эта игра точно не для вас. Да она и не собирается на это претендовать.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006784693', 'num_games_owned': 415, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 510, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1694930389}
review:
Fun rogue-like game. Co-op has a few minor bugs but it's so much fun that I can over look them. 

The Constellation system allows you to tweek your skills and cool downs to fit your style of play. Yes it will take a bit of grinding, but it's a rogue-like that's what you do.

Overall I've enjoyed it immensely and will be playing many more hours.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016442964', 'num_games_owned': 1555, 'num_reviews': 302, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 143, 'last_played': 1694696595}
review:
I bought this game day 1 on Epic Games Store in early access and it was quite fun with a lot of potential but this full release honestly just sucks massively in so many ways I can't even describe it.
The style of the game is tremendous with the old school cartoon vibes, great characters, voice acting and music but that's about it.

When it comes to gameplay it flops incredibly. 
-Hit detection is awful, especially with charge attacks if your charge attack doesn't get stopped by some random pixel.
-The stamina system is just atrociously bad. You are being bombarded by waves on waves of enemies each of them taking a lot of hits to take down so you have to just wait it out and regen which just sucks. 
-Waves are too long.
-Enemies have insanely high HP which makes them feel "bullet spongy"
-The meta progression is straight up bad. If you want better items or perks you have to upgrade with a currency that is super scarce and you also have to get the upgrades with gold and this grind is just too much for some really minor upgrades.

This feels more like an Early Access game now then it did when it initially released into EA. I'd say wait for updates and a deep sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023419846', 'num_games_owned': 3234, 'num_reviews': 135, 'playtime_forever': 269, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 148, 'last_played': 1694872600}
review:
Mythforce once again reminds me that Steam really should have a "mixed feelings" option for recommendation, as this game is in what I'd class a weird position, however in it's current standing, I feel I have to lean towards negative. (For Context: As of review time, I have beaten 4 levels, and shall update one I finish the rest.)

Mythforce has the look and graphically works well within the idea of it being a TV show from the 80's or so, character design wise look like they'd easily fit in, and the games opening cinematic has a lovely nostalgic feel to it, with a tune I find somewhat addictive, honestly this was originally the thing that got me interested in the game.

Character wise we have 4 to pick from, Tank, Mage, Ranger, Rogue. Each bring their own abilities with them and feel different enough to warrant experimenting with. The characters have some personality, but personally, I feel a bit more could of been done with them, maybe make them a bit cheesier, give it that proper old school feel with how they speak, also some more lines would of been good, as I constantly hear the same lines within 30 seconds (Note: Apparently the characters "bark" less now according to the 1st hotfix, however I didn't notice that much of a difference on my end, still seemed too often).

Loading into the game, you're hit with a wall of text as your "tutorial", having a small level to help introduce players into the game and explaining how things work would of been a better choice, but either way, you'll get the info you need to get going.

Being a Rogue-like similar to Gunfire Reborn, as you progress you'll gain perks to level your hero, normally having 3 options for you to pick from, they will reset per run and you can set up your character in weird and wonderful ways.

The Combat is basic in nature and sadly, currently, feels somewhat clunky, movement and attacking just feels a bit off, like it needs a bit more speed to it, enemies so far haven't had much variation and can feel very sponge-like taking damage, I've not felt challenged particularly, but on the odd time enemies have cornered me or some such, it just feels more tedious than fun to deal with them, I've had the odd enemy glitch into the floor or shoot to the sky as well, as I've progressed into following levels, I was seeing more of the same enemies already, just with bigger health bars and higher damage, I'd of expected *some* variation in the first few levels at least, but I could be being overly picky on that front.

So far, the constellation system for upgrading yourself personally seems slightly pointless, I understand it will take multiple runs to upgrade it properly, but so far, it just feels like it will be a tedious task, knowing that I have to grind out crystals to upgrade, regardless, you'll get options to boost defence, damage, reduce cool-downs and such, you also have a store to buy weapons, outfits, emotes and voice lines, some of that stuff is overpriced in my opinion, but i suppose they need to try and encourage replayability.

As no friends have purchased the game yet, my only experience of online has been me joining on a random game, and having someone random join me, and so far, it's very much been a bad experience, despite my internet being decent, having constant lag or ping issues made it irritating, also seemingly only having quick play and no option to look for rooms or specific missions to join feels silly in a game that seems to push the co-op as a major selling point.

The first big boss was a fine fight, nothing to write home about, I loved how the game used the main theme in a remix, giving it a nice feel, but after beating it, I didn't feel fulfilled, I just felt like it was time to stop playing for a bit, as it was just an OK experience.

Overall currently, that's the problem for me with this game, it's just...OK, and lately, the gaming community has been constantly served great or amazing games,  feeling OK or just passable isn't enough now, this game needs work if it wants to stand out, it needs love from its dev team and it needs to start putting the right foot forward, this game COULD be great, it could be like the great cartoons that you love to come back to and view again and again, but for now, it's just a re-run at 6am on a random channel when most people are asleep, sure, some might catch it, but one it hits 7, the real good shows start.

I truly hope that as I progress in the game, my feelings will change and I can change this review to positive, however I doubt that, not until more work has been put into the game, I'd advise waiting for a sale as it stands for now.

[strike] (Edit #1: Achievements don't work, woo) [/strike]  

(Edit #2 : as of the First hot-fix patch, Achievements have now been fixed & the stamina system has been improved a little bit, but not enough done yet overall to change this review positive)

author: {'steamid': '76561197972530829', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1694960147}
review:
I'll give it a positive, but this is a mixed review, but TLDR: Buy if on sale.

Good: Art style; intro song; roguelike/lite for replay-ability (only good if you like/understand this game type. some people dislike this game type)

Bad: Combat could be more interesting; AI is simple; maps are repetitive, town UI is pretty horrible and took me a second to realize I could interact with the buildings.

Mixed Feedback:
There is "build" variety in the gem/constellation system, and some control over your roguelite runs with affinity system to influence gear and upgrades. Armory system lets you change up primary/secondary weapon and level up damage for your selected build type, but this all feels mostly generic and could use some extra style to make each build stand out change how the character is played completely (something like a speed build, or a tank build, or a ranged build, utility build, etc.)

The game is fun and engaging enough, but lacking something to make it really hook the players. Would be great for couch co-op or in an actual arcade. It is missing an "excitement" feel to it though. There were no times when I was running with a group where it felt like we had to strategize or felt amazing for beating a boss or hard encounter. We just ran around and hit things till they died. More development may help this game really stand out, and I feel a lot of love for the 80s in this with the art style and it is fairly polished for what it is, but it needs time to grow, which I hope it will.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136237679', 'num_games_owned': 273, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1694817488}
review:
Коротко: Хорошая боёвка, 4 разных класса с разными умениями, Онлайн до 3-х человек. Но... Фризы (при нормальном FPS), повторяющиеся локации и незаметный сюжет.
Посмотреть геймплей можно тут:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qcbgkolOpRE&list=PL1ZT56GX95wq79BNNS02bFekaqi427x9O&index=1

Подробнее:
[list]
[*]Графика: Нормально. Не Вау, но и Не Ужас.
[*]Производительность: FPS хотелось бы побольше, но пойдёт. Проблема с фризами.... Игра фризит. При этом когда играешь один - фризов меньше.
[*]Звуки: Они есть. Больше ничего сказать не могу))))
[*]Геймплей: 4 разных класса, с разными способностями: Танк, Лучник, Кинжальщик и Маг. После начала "Задания" вы заходите на карту, в которой несколько "комнат". "Комнаты" в случайном порядке. Что бы попасть на следующую - нужно зачистить предыдущую. И вот тут главная проблема: Комнаты повторяются. И повторятся они начинают достаточно быстро. Т.Е. вы фактически будете бегать по нескольким комнатам. Между комнатами вы будете получать дополнительные пассивные способности.
[*]Сюжет: Ну он тут есть, но я его как то не уловил.
[*]Кооп: Есть, до 3-х человек.
[/list]

Моё мнение: Хорошая игра на пару вечеров.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983546384', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 90, 'playtime_forever': 1697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1695031957}
review:
Questo gioco non è perfetto, ma è comunque godibile.
Si tratta di un roguelite diviso in livelli e ogni livello è diviso in "stanze" o arene se preferite, dove arrivano nemici a ondate, finita la stanza si passa alla successiva. Tra una stanza e l'altra ci possono essere negozi o tesori vari e metà livello c'è un Boss, a fine livello invece, per adesso ho visto solo nemici elite. Come ogni gioco di questo genere, i potenziamenti che si trovano sono casuali, ma posso dire che fino ad ora non ne ho trovato nessuno inutile, anzi. Durante il gioco si raccolgono delle gemme e i soldi, che restano anche in caso di sconfitta. Notate bene che morite nel secondo livello, ripetete solo quello, non vi dovete rifare tutto daccapo.  Le gemme servono per potenziare varie skill e i soldi per acquistare o potenziare equipaggiamento. Ci sono 4 classi tra cui scegliere, ognuna si tiene i propri soldi, ma le gemme si accumulano per tutti e anche la progressione dei livelli è comune, ovvero e finite il primo livello con la guerriera, al secondo potete andarci con l'arcere. E' evidente che la componente melee è presa da Vermintide ed è divertente, i nemici sono un po' legnosi a volte i combattimenti risultano un po' lenti e impacciati a causa più dei nemici che di come si muove il vostro personaggio che invece si comporta molto bene. Comunque mi sento di promuoverlo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056606169', 'num_games_owned': 190, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 531, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 198, 'last_played': 1694907314}
review:
I haven't heard about this game until a week before release. I instantly bought it for 2 main reasons:
1. I like roguelikes/-lites, and similar games including looter-shooters.
2. 80's cartoons. Do I even need to explain this?
Now, as I went through the reviews here on steam, I assumed that a bunch if kids tried this game and failed.
If we go through main complaints:
1. Uses Epic Games - well...no. It only uses Epic Online Services (EOS), not the launcher. You can hate Epic Games Launcher for whatever reason, but I see no issue with using EOS. 
2. ThE pRoGrEsS iS nOt sAveD afTeR eAcH rUn - do you even know what a roguelite is? You do some runs by using everything you can get during the run just to get to the finishing line. Once the run is over you use resources you found (shards, glyphs, gold...whatever) to upgrade your heroes in the main hub. The upgrades include weapons, trinkets, perks, items...You also have some cosmetics to buy. 
3. Not rewarding runs, perks have no effect - you gather resources to upgrade yourself as I stated previously. And traits do have an effect of combined properly. If you take a melee, but you are using a bow, of course that trait will be useless. 
4. Repetitive loop - I can agree the game needs a bit a more level variety, but it is still fun. 

Overall, I enjoyed the game for 3 hours I had after work. Will play a lot more. If you are looking for a looter shooter - that is not your game. It starts slow and gets better later. Also, it works pretty good on deck.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022994188', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 180, 'playtime_forever': 1565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 4, 'playtime_at_review': 260, 'last_played': 1712313442}
review:
Ce n'est pas le jeu de l'année mais il a le mérite de pouvoir nous faire passer des bons moments entre potes ou pickups via la matchmaking. On peut regretter le manque de contenu pour le moment et à la rigueur sa ressemblance à un autre jeu ce qui du coup, prouve son manque d'innovation  : "Gunfire Reborn"
Je lui met quand un pouce levé pour encourager les devs mais aussi parce que j'ai passé des bons moments dessus :
4 classes à ce jour avec deux armes et 3 pouvoirs : Mage - Chevalier - Chasseur - Voleur  
Dans le village on peut trouver  :
- L'armurerie avec possibilité d'acheter des armes plus puissantes et de les renforcer 
- "Le Disque Solaire" Système d'amélioration de caractéristiques (attaque-dégâts-régénération etc.) appelé "constellation"
- "Le Conclave" pour améliorer ses atouts
etc.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991092311', 'num_games_owned': 405, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 154, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1694614698}
review: Beim ersten Versuch bin ich im dritten Abschnitt des ersten Levels durch den Boden gefallen und kam nicht mehr hoch, musste den gesamten Versuch abbrechen. Also neugestartet. Beim zweiten Versuch konnte ich dann das Eingangstutorial nicht wegklicken. Funktioniert ja großartig das Spiel! ...nicht
developer_response:
Hey, vielen Dank für deine Bewertung. Es hat dazu beigetragen, das Spiel zu verbessern und besser zu machen.

Wir haben gerade ein umfangreiches QoL-Update veröffentlicht, das viele Probleme behoben hat. Probieren Sie es aus und teilen Sie uns Ihre Erfahrungen mit.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980171460', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1694544845}
review:
TLDR; a co-op roguelite with great aesthetic charm that stumbles in multi-player. Not recommended at current price and/or until additional features are added. Requested a refund due to multi-player limitations as noted below. 

(+) Love the animation style
(+) Character skills and playstyles are fairly distinct
(+) Decent number of upgradable structures and attributes between runs 
(+/-) In-game character interactions (i.e., between the characters being played) are humerous, but I suspect the commentary may get old
(-) Multiplayer matchmaking is completely obfuscated from the player - no way of knowing if you will join a co-op game or if someone will join yours
(-) A decent number of bugs at release which is surprising given this has been out on the Epic store for ~1 year
(-) No current roadmap announced - unclear what the future investment will be for the game
(--) Co-op communication limited to canned chat messages - no text chat, voice chat, etc.
developer_response:
Hi there! Thanks a lot for your review. It helped improve the game and make it better.

We've just released a massive QoL update that fixed a ton of stuff, especially regarding previous Multiplayer issues. Check it out and let us know about your gaming experience.

On top of the improvements we’ve already added to 1.0.3.0, the next patch will focus on even greater improvements in your moment-to-moment combat experience focusing on responsiveness, combat flow, and improving the functionality of your abilities.

https://store.steampowered.com/news/app/363860/view/5912724862977977688

author: {'steamid': '76561198798058089', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1694599793}
review:
玩了第一关，大概30min，差不多6种怪，骷髅刀兵，骷髅剑兵，骷髅弓箭手，罐子宝箱怪，蘑菇战士，蘑菇法师和一个蘑菇boss，另一个boss，就这么几种怪反复打了这么久，全地形重复遇到两次，个别地形3次。
  可选英雄4个，每个英雄三个技能，外加一个过载，不知道什么效果，有点像强化，然后放个背景音乐。技能上的只有三个强化，其他的都是平A带元素，吸血，眩晕各种状态，生命耐力之类的。
  关卡目前就看到9关，联机和我好友玩不太理想，开了加速器他玩法师经常没有伤害（多半是延迟问题），如果这游戏是在epic上的话我觉得这个问题应该挺正常的。
  总结：内容太少，定价太高，想玩这类型的游戏不如去玩枪火重生和临渊觉醒，前面的还在更新，本体70来块，后面的制作组跑路状态中，80多块，都是国产的，都比这游戏内容多，价格便宜。想买这个游戏的可以等打折，除非你不差钱，最近还没有游戏玩，又刚好有几个朋友一起闲着，那可以买来玩，个人觉得目前的内容只值30—40块，后面内容更新了可以提价格，学学人家GTFO，正式版出了才提价格，已经更新了6个赛季才出的正式版，还贼耐玩。

author: {'steamid': '76561197993329136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 186, 'playtime_forever': 106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1695164434}
review:
Nobody reads these reviews anyway, so I'll just leave here that I like the game.





Haha, okay, seriously.  I like the game.  I'm gonna tell you about the game, and then I'm gonna talk about a couple things I see people don't like.  It's my opinion, leave a clown or something or just scream in the comments, I'm cool either way.

What it is is a first-person melee game.  That's like a first person shooting game, except the ranges are really low.  Like, y'know, melee.  Short range hack-and-slash.  It's a whole lot less of "put reticule on bad guy and click" and a whole lot more "get close enough to do that reticule thing."

There's a couple characters that do more ranged stuff.  Couldn't tell you much, I've been playing the swashbuckler-guy exclusively.  My wife's been using the paladork lady, because being a big meatwall with a shield is her jam.  It's cool.

We've been streaming it on alternate accounts, so I've got more time on this game than you think.

The playstyle is more methodical, rewarding good positioning and being aware of the enemies.  And flailing away with attacks can get punished, so you need to keep your attacks measured and even.  Getting hit in the back does a lot more damage, and with no radar you really need to keep looking around.  There's a brief "you are about to get hit from this direction" symbol, which is your only clue you're going to get walloped.  The game will end you quickly if you're inattentive or impatient.  I rather like this.

It's got "roguelike" elements, where progressive playthroughs let you unlock benefits which permanently upgrade your character.  If you enjoy a bit of snark, you can replace skill with persistence.

What it looks like is cel-shaded.  It's trying to be "Saturday-morning cartoons" and I can believe it, except Saturday-morning cartoons never had a framerate this smooth, or for that matter, looked this nice.  When I was a child and watching cartoons, they were flat-out rubbish.  I watched them anyway.

Another thing that makes it suitably Saturday-morning cartoon is the plot, and the voice-acting.  It's one thing to be a mediocre voice talent doing a cartoon (writes the guy who is a mediocre, *at best*, voice talent) but it's another to ape that style convincingly.  It's very, very difficult to be a believably so-so actor on purpose.  Which means they're great.

There's also a plot, revealed in tiny dribs and drabs, about some guy named "Deadalus" (this name is brilliant, seriously) who has an army of undead and other things that... I'm not sure, villainy no doubt.  But a plucky band of heroes will foil their plan every Saturday morning, I'm sure.

Okay, finally, coop.  Right?  If you've read my reviews, you know I love this stuff.  Parties came together smoothly, gameplay was had.  Excellent.

A couple sticking points:  The game kind of throws you right in there with just a couple static screens of tutorial to explain the works.  Truth be told, it doesn't really need it, except maybe to explain what the super-powerup-MythForce attack does.  You stab (or shoot) bad guys.  You try to avoid getting hit.

Arrows kind of come from out of nowhere, and exposure to spellcasters doesn't come 'til mostly through the first dungeon sequence.  The solution for all of the above is to keep moving, pretty much, but my first encounter was unpleasant to say the least.

Areas in the first mission have been a bit samey.  There's perhaps six or eight rooms, though they'll arrange them so you come in from different doors.  But you soon realize where the hidden loot is.  So a little variety mightn't go amiss.

Some people have moaned about "EOS", confusing "Epic Online Services" with the Epic Game Store (which is abbreviated EGS but come on, people).  It's an Unreal Engine Game.  It's going to have EOS.  It doesn't make you buy games from their store, it installs itself once, and it lets you play with people pretty smoothly.  I'm no fan of their game store at all, and have snubbed it so hard the only game I bought there I bought again on Steam, but let's get our facts together here, eh?

Anyway, a game that rewards patience and positioning, runs great, and is a bit cheesy?  It's my kind of game.  MythForce is a great coop adventure.  I don't know how many legs it has, but I expect the missus and I may go through the whole campaign at least once, and I'll probably try to headlock a few friends into getting copies so we can run a full team.  It'll be a good number of streaming episodes, if anything.  It's got my swashbuckling thumb up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081111924', 'num_games_owned': 838, 'num_reviews': 259, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1694567327}
review:
Мені подобається студія Beamdog як мінімум через те, що вони зробили Enhanced Edition таких культових для мене ігор як Neverwinter Nights та Icewind Dale. Але побігавши в цю гру - я не можу високо оцінити їх проект. Відео з оглядом https://youtu.be/U4bO-J30Tcw - а текстом нижче:
Насамперед, це не ранній доступ. Почекайте хейтери раннього доступу, я поясню - такі ігри мають бути реіграбельними на купу годин, і у інді студій зазвичай банально немає можливостей і часу все це зробити під перший реліз. При цьому потрібен активний тестинг, при цьому в жанрі roguelike потрібно багато чого балансувати та фіксити. А коли бачиш відразу реліз то ти розумієш, що скоріш за все - це фінальний продукт. Нажаль статистика продажів гри дуже на все впливає і у більшості випадків для ігор орієнтованих на мультиплеєр - дуже важко триматися на ринку якщо банально мало гравців.
Ця гра у стилі Gunfire Reborn та Ziggurat, це досить специфічний жанр, але він має немало своїх фанатів. Але він сфокусований на коопі - 4 гравці в ідеалі мають бігати різними класами та знищувати монстрів з драйвовим настроєм. На справі я встиг потестити кооп вдвох з рандомним паладіном - і після виграної катки він відразу лівнув з гри бо чесно кажучи ці 25 хвилин були дуже сумні. Якщо в соло ти ще якось проходячи рівень перший раз відчуваєш дуже сильно свою прогресію, то вдвох це виглядає як хаос з трохи крінжовими монстрами і не особливо креативними аренами для битв. Зброї не дуже багато видів, посилення скілів і перки хоч і рятують трохи ситуацію, але це все не змінює відчуття, що ти граєш в ранній доступ якогось скромного проекту. А у нас тут вже реліз за 549 гривень. Не можу рекомендувати, суб'єктивно - досить млявий проект без якихось особливостей та моментів, які б хотілося відзначити в позитивному ключі. Можливо я вже задовбався грати в roguelike за 2018-2021 роки але от отримав 0 задоволення і не можу уявити, як його можна щиро отримати чи протриватися в грі більше кількох годин. Не рекомендую

P.S. Якщо цікавитеся новинками інді ігор - запрошую підписуватись на [url=https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC_3mBOq0pq00QOXxrpMFhZg] мій Youtube канал з оглядами, [/url] там багато цікавенького :)

author: {'steamid': '76561197990454937', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3183, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 325, 'last_played': 1703202480}
review:
One feels transported back to the cartoons of the 80s.
Choose a hero and team up in cooperative mode to beat up the villains and their countless henchmen. Nice!
The dungeons/castles, etc. of each chapter are randomly generated, similar to Diablo. They do repeat, yes. Some more different rooms would be nice but its ok.
You can do it, Beamdog! ;)   
At the end of each chapter, there's a boss waiting, along with a cutscene in the style of 80s cartoons that advances the story.

I partially disagree with some of the reviews here.
The game isn't launched through the Epic Launcher, and there are no missing save options.(after all, it's a roguelike)
At the end of each run, you can permanently enhance your character to progress further in the story.

Regarding the claim of always having the same skills, that's not entirely accurate either.
As you progress through the game, you'll come across items that significantly modify your skills. For example, you can turn a static turret into a permanent companion or transform a stationary shield into a frost sphere which follows your steps.

Each ability can be modified in three additional ways, which complement each other. As a result, you end up with completely different abilities than you had at the beginning of the run.

If you're up for a cooperative roguelike experience, this is the right place for you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008302916', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 129, 'playtime_forever': 1710, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 28, 'playtime_at_review': 233, 'last_played': 1712334771}
review:
Updated review after playing for much longer. At first i really wasn't sure i liked this game but over the week since launch i have found that i can't stop playing it, so i'm updating my review to reflect that:

The more i play this game the more it clicks and the more i fall in love.

Right at the start anyone that grew up in the 80s will fall in love with the whole presentation. The developers and the art team behind this game absolutely knocked the presentation out of the park. The sounds, the music, the characters make me feel like a kid watching He-Man again. The visuals of the game, the way the environments are lit and rendered are absolutely stunning as well. You can stop moving at any point during game-play and you have a screenshot right our of a Saturday morning cartoon. Its impressive.

On top of that the game runs butter smooth across all settings on both my PC and on my Steam Deck. 

The Deck can run the game at an impressive 60fps without a sweat if you drop to low settings and because of the art style the game looks just fine. Or if you want to turn on that gorgeous global illumination you can set that to mid and keep everything else at low and you get a very solid 40fps. Both are more than playable.  The game controls wonderfully on the deck as well. I actually think its my favourite place to play.

At first the game didn't hook me in the way i was somehow expecting. I couldn't put my finger on it and i thought i didn't enjoy it. However i have found myself playing this every evening or picking up the steam deck to do an episode run whenever i get a moment.

Each run takes around 20 minutes and each time i finish i now want to do just one more. It's great. Now that the game has clicked for me an i'm into it's rhythm i totally love it.

I think the best games are the ones that do take a bit of time to warm up to. Those are usually the ones that stick with me the most. I've got a disgustingly large Steam library and so i tend to float away to other games quite easily. This one has kept me coming back and is becoming one of my favourite pick up and play titles.

The developers seem to be listening across steam and their discord. It is clear they are taking everyone's complaints about the game into consideration.

This feels like the sort of game that will continue to grow and get better over time.

I'm really glad i gave this title the time it truly deserves and i can't wait to continue to play and also see how it grows and develops.

author: {'steamid': '76561198286825419', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 116, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1694585931}
review:
个人评分5/10

没参与过开放测试，个人感觉目前的游戏状态是符合正常游戏开放测试阶段的水平的，换句话说，作为正式发售的游戏，还不完善。

优点：动作较为流畅，画面风格能切中一部分玩家的心。

缺点：目前UI并不完善，游戏指引只是仓促在游戏开头放个四页的拦截页面，大厅界面十分粗糙。 作为肉鸽游戏，游戏流程内部的随机物品、随机技能mutator，目前来看并没有可以改变游戏模式的内容，换句话说，只是单纯的给你既有的装备技能增加些伤害，能让你多挥舞几下武器而已，因此在长久可玩性上我不抱太大希望。

author: {'steamid': '76561198075741510', 'num_games_owned': 409, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1694589500}
review:
I played several hours of the demo, enjoyed the experience at the time and thought it had lots of potential, but upon returning months later for the full game, and only minutes after getting back in to it, much of what I once enjoyed now feels tired, and many of the things I hoped were placeholders are still there, making the full experience fall flat.

I really would've loved if this had more varied maps with proper enemy placement and a moody soundtrack instead of feeling like an endless survival mode in copy/pasted prefabs sections. It's just such a wasted potential. I don't know how to describe it, but it feels like the enemies don't occupy the same space as the location.

The roguelite mechanic is easily the worst aspect for me, especially in the form of drawing cards between rounds. Stopping the game entirely to have me make a choice in a hallway between random perks and debuffs instead of designing and balancing the gameplay from the start is just frustrating.

It just doesn't feel like it's ready for release, and tests my patience with every step which is a shame because the premise, art style and presentation of this game are everything that I should love. There are games like Hi-Fi Rush that have that 2d look in a 3D space, but this game takes it to a very unique place visually. I want to play it every time I see a screenshot or promo but then once I'm in it just feels so tedious.

author: {'steamid': '76561199367829272', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 555, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 555, 'last_played': 1694577623}
review: i thought it was a good game, not sure if priced right as its not very big, but gameplay was good although some things  buggy for example skills getting stuck and not being used and magic attacks hitting invisible walls and not doing aoe damage even when 5 mobs all over the radius of effect. melee and bow are viable and what got me through to the end. hopefully future update make this an unbeatable rougelike

author: {'steamid': '76561197965140518', 'num_games_owned': 952, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 4737, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 3, 'playtime_at_review': 4008, 'last_played': 1711327810}
review:
I've been playing the game for a long while now, beta and early access. I enjoy the characters a great deal, the voice acting is top notch and the interaction dialogue gets me to audibly laugh despite having heard some of the chains multiple times.

Gameplay is slower but more intentional (strategic) than some others in the genre of Co-op games like this making it good for folks who aren't as extremely twitch based, and that's been great in group play. Where Mythforce shines in this regard is with the true RNG of perks and enchantments making each play through different plus the generated level maps. Plus the art style stands outs well and is super charming.

author: {'steamid': '76561198061323332', 'num_games_owned': 1573, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 69, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 69, 'last_played': 1694557278}

author: {'steamid': '76561198101934705', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1694576890}
review:
Was very much looking forward to this game with it on my wish list for so long. I think it needs improvement for my to try it again.
Here are my main gripes:

Edit: My main gripes were with no auto spring and blurriness. The developers responded kindly to tell me how to get around these which I'm grateful for. I did not see the toggle for auto sprint nor did I know which setting would affect the blurriness.The setting change helps a lot while exhausted, but idk, the graininess of the games general nature is something I wish I could toggle.

Even trying once more with these changes, the game really isn't drawing me in as I hoped. I will change my review to positive as the settings aren't as bad as I perceived and I give immense props to the devs for replying to my review to assist me. Wishing this team the best and for an even better version in the future.
developer_response:
Hi NobleSupremacy! In the controls options menu right up at the top, there's a setting for "Hold to Sprint" - Unchecking that box will change it so that you will continue to sprint until you stop moving after pressing the sprint key.

You can also reduce or remove the exhaustion and film grain effects in the graphics options by lowering your "post processing" setting.

Hope those help you have a more enjoyable time with the game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198164013736', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 2074, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 179, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1712423572}
review:
Mythforce is awesome and makes for a great coop FPS Dungeon crawl experience. The team did an excellent job of capturing that cartoon experience with the visuals, soundtrack, and cutscenes. Playing with multiple people is where the game really shines with every character having their own distinct feel. Not necessarily a "horde" game but the combat does remind me of Vermintide a little bit

Yes, the game does use Epic Online Services but this is NOT the Epic game store platform and the EGS launcher is not required. No 3rd party launcher is required.

The game does have it's weird quirks where things control a little funky and the game is procedural generated so you may see similar level pieces from time to time. I felt the gameplay far outshined these issues but with some extra polish it will only add to the enjoyment. The Meta progression for each character is pretty extensive and I am really looking to sinking some more time into this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198234782060', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 108, 'last_played': 1694542105}
review:
This game is not for everyone as it can be challenging and repetitive since you might have to grind a lot before you can progress. If you like playing co-op games like vermintide II, darksiders genesis, and risk of rain 2, this might be for you.

Sample gameplay: https://youtu.be/NA_2fuUOMR4

I kind of agree to some sentiment that this does not feel like a full released game yet. It really feels there is a lot missing pieces, especially the reward with the progress. Still, it has a good gameplay and likable character designs. You can also always wait for steam sale if you think its not worth the price. 

For what its worth, I had fun. Giving this a thumbs up and hoping there will be more updates.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057666654', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 168, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 1, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1711476117}
review:
I have been eagerly waiting the release for Steam. 

The art, music and animation are exactly what I always thought games to look like ever since I bought a copy of Might&Magic 6 as a kid. Yet they never did! - One of the reasons I became an artist!

Though I have only player Chapter 1 as of this writing, everything works. Can you imagine that? Everything actually working in a game in early access? Simple done well is great.

The only thing holding this game back is content. What the game thus far does, it does so flawlessly. The current rating of mixed are absurd.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052798031', 'num_games_owned': 415, 'num_reviews': 119, 'playtime_forever': 703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1694997757}
review:
Buggy. Abilities don't cast a lot, lag in MP, poison effect stuck on screen until death. Why do we need to click each meta currency individually? Spamming F on the ground to pick up crystals/glyphs etc feels horrible. Especially considering the interact key isn't always responsive and is touchy. It's 2023, give us auto loot for that crap. You have to be ON TOP of gold for pickup, there's 0 radius.  Items are way too small on the ground. 

Small amount of content. Scaling cost of upgrades is just a tedious grind. Wait for sale or 1-2 years of updates. Play Gunfire Reborn. Much better and cheaper.

Gameplay loop is average for the genre. Maps are very quickly repetitive even in first zone you'll see like 2 "different" layouts. Same tileset each time and only difference is 1 or 2 rooms are reversed in layout. Big whoop.

The damn Steam achievements don't even work properly. Quests in game = Steam achievements so it's easy to know.
developer_response:
Hi there! Thanks a lot for your review. It helped improve the game and make it better. We've implemented your feedback and released a huge update for MythForce.

https://store.steampowered.com/news/app/363860/view/5912724862977977688

author: {'steamid': '76561198069610047', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 270, 'last_played': 1694726047}
review: If you like Co-Op games like this than you will like this! I like how easy it is to have someone join your game because this game is more fun with players IMO. My experience with Randos have been actually very good so I hope more people pick it up. The cartoon style and music is awesome.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083222013', 'num_games_owned': 2588, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1694565653}
review:
Pros:
El arte del juego es espectacular. Realmente esta muy bien logrado. Y ya esta

Contras: 
El gameplay es muy aburrido. Los personajes son demasiados toscos de manejar.
Los niveles realmente son repetitivos. Esto lo lei mucho pero no pensaba que realmente iba a ser asi.
La precarga a los servidores de Epic games en vez de utilizar el mismo servicio que ofrece Steam.
El rendimiento deja mucho que desear.
La pantalla de titulo parece sacada de un juego en estado Early Access, siendo la misma muy poco intuitiva.
La banda sonora no es muy memorable que digamos. Es recomendable jugarlo sin la misma ya que es muy aburrida

Lamentablemente este es uno de esos extraños casos en los que el juego es perfecto visualmente, pero apela a la mediocridad en todo lo demás. Estoy siendo bastante critico con este juego debido a su precio. Por lo que vale no podes ofrecer un producto "completo" en este estado

author: {'steamid': '76561198171050929', 'num_games_owned': 2009, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1694565640}
review: Lo poco que jugué, puedo decir que artísticamente está buenísimo, pero el gameplay es muy tosco y lento, si fallas un golpe y estas con baja resistencia o stamina, quedás a merced de los enemigos. Sumado a esto, precarga la interfaz de Epic Games para los servidores en lugar de usar el mismo servicio de Steam haciendo que en mi caso, tenga caidas de rendimiento. En otros aspectos como la pantalla de Lobby y pantalla de inicio es casi como si fuera un Early access, en este estado no puedo recomendar el juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046465234', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 199, 'last_played': 1694563632}
review:
I was  really looking forward for this game, probably I'm probably one of the few people that got hyped from the trailer.
Anyway...
In summary ; Good idea, awful executed. The game feeeels waaay to lazy
Good stuff 
- Graphics are nice , althought I kinda understand most people won't like it.
That's about it.
Bad Stuff.
- Combat is broken, ranged weapons are waaay to OP while melee combat it's too punishing. I get it, Melee combat is more focused in block and parry but it's kinda hard to when you're surrounded by enemies, while I can just shoot arrows from a safe distance, heck arrows deal more damage than meelee weapons anyway since it's really easy to aim to the head and crit.
- Loot system :  In Dungeons you only find money, which can be use to upgrade weapons, items, trinkets. Exploring a dungeon is meaningless when you're going to find only money. There's no new weapons armors or any new stuff to be excited for,
-Equip system. Awful, you have a few options for weapons, there's no armor system or character customization option.
-Lack of content : after two runs you probaly have seen every trinket and modifiers.  Also only 9 stages.
This game feels like a early access game, it may have better to launch as one. Right now the game feels too repetitive, boring and lacks content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198964466030', 'num_games_owned': 480, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1695445801}
review: It's a fun rogue that is visually stunning. However, the game needs more room variations to really feel like a complete experience. After all it's not great walking into the same exact room set-up multiple times during a single run.

author: {'steamid': '76561197965491212', 'num_games_owned': 3046, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1700778605}
review:
I love the premise and art style. If you grew up in the 80s, Mythforce conjures up Dungeons and Dragons, He-Man, and Dragon's Lair (technically a cartoon video game, but still). 

Comparisons to Gunfire Reborn are superficial at best. The physics and combat in Gunfire are far more polished and responsive. If you are expecting gameplay akin to Gunfire or Borderlands, you will be disappointed. If you are expecting it not to install Epic's Game Store launcher, you will be VERY disappointed (note to devs: you need to patch that out, ASAP). 

This game does not feel finished, but the potential here is huge. I hope the studio does the right thing and incrementally works at bringing this game into its own. It's poised, just on the strength of the art style, of being at the top of the rogue-like looter-shooter pyramid. 

In the future, if Mythforce wants to become legendary, it will channel a far-future setting (think Jack Vance's Dying Earth or M. John Harrison's Viriconium stories) and marry it to visuals that will evoke Thundarr the Barbarian without calling down the wrath of IP lawyers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198344515406', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 438, 'last_played': 1695403386}

author: {'steamid': '76561198001200280', 'num_games_owned': 580, 'num_reviews': 194, 'playtime_forever': 470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1695369941}
review:
First of all, let me clarify- This is not a thumbs down, game bad thing, this is a "Steam needs a Middle option for reviews" thing. Because I'm not mad at it, and it's not really bad, my negative review is STRICTLY because I think the price is too high for what they're peddling.

This game is "ok", but it's not really a $30+ game at ALL.This is my biggest gripe. This would be a really great option in the $19-$24.99 bracket, you know, where I expect Indie games that aren't quite up to AAA quality to sit. 

GET IT ON SALE, GET IT ON SALE, GET IT ON SALE. Wait for a sale, it will be worth it on sale. 

It's real arrogant of these guys to throw it up on EGS for a year, and then bring it to Steam STILL f*cking unfinished, and missing basic coop game options, like voice chat, 
or a text box, for example. BTW, this game has neither and wants you to use a sh*tty radial menu during combat. This is another example of "just ok".  Actual great games will generally let you talk to other players because they don't have a cucumber in charge of that department.

These guys made a coop game where you can't talk to the people you randomly meet, that's not "good". I don't CARE about it, but it's not a "good" design. It's basic af, and only "ok" 

It's got a great art style and it has some cool features, and IS fun, BUT-

-it makes you install EOS, which heavily depends on you, because some people are like f*ck epic, and some people aren't, but the ones who ARE, will refund instantly if a game has it. 
-Sound design is weird and while it exists, it's like a bunch of times i kept thinking, "man, this sound design sure sucks, i can't tell where creatures are at, and there's like a ton of sliders for audio but you really don't need that many, you just need to do a good job at the default settings, which they did not. 
-hitting barrels and pots gives you money! this is generally cool, but in this game, it's really underwhelming. 
-there's an overall lack of visual and audio WOW factor. The art design is great, but it's like they're just counting on that to make everything cool, and it doesn't really do it for ME? For example, there's no like special auras around dropped items, or stuff they want to direct your attention to, it just kind of exists in the world, where other games will be give that thing an outline, or make it sparkle a little bit to draw the eye? This does not do that. 
-They went with a sort of hybrid system of like overwatch skills, and what feels like half-a-vermintide for melee. It's ALMOST really good, but as it is, it's decent and passable. 

Overall, for me, this sits at around a 6.5 out of 10. There's a ton of room for improvement, and it's even more pathetic when you learn that this game has been out on EGS in early access for about a year now, and it STILL has a bunch of stuff that needs work. 

I'm going to give some time before fully making my decision. I wish that these reviews had a middle option, but right now i can't thumbs this sh*t up, the price is too high and it's really not much more than, just, "ok"

author: {'steamid': '76561198070616040', 'num_games_owned': 505, 'num_reviews': 270, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 133, 'last_played': 1694549631}
review:
it's so basic...there is barely any progression and the game itself is slow and makes you backtrack. A normal dungeon consists of "magical doors" blocking you inside, enemies spawning in different cornes and you waiting for them to spawn and attack you.
I compared the game with City of Brass(2018) in my video https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QL0uj841MIs
The sound is terrible, you can't hear enemies behind you, the music doesn't fit the game, the progression of the city(upgrades) feels so grindy and basic. The characters you can chose from(4 playable) are pretty much as all steretypes in magical adventure games.
Pro: somewhat nice art, fun for a dungeon run(about 12 minutes), nice overall artwork for enemies and bosses, one of the only fps roguelikes
Cons: very repetitive, boring map design, most times you wait for enemies to spawn in a small space, looting makes you backtrack, sound design and music is very bad, you cant hear enemies behind you, game repeats the same shop rooms but makes them bigger than regular dungeons so you waste time. 
The main hub, the city, is just a picture, nothing move in it, upgrades are barely incremental, items have very low bonuses, game feels like it has 2005 mechanics, i see no progress in roguelike.
A few words about multiplayer: THERE IS NO SINGLEPLAYER, it makes you choose between Open and Friends Only.
It downloads epic game store software for crossplay at the start even if you never intend to play multiplayer.
There is no server browser option you can either play with friends or HOPE to get a playable server, it should not be listed  as co-op or multiplayer.
Steam really has to start improving the information shown about games, i have seen too many games that only have invite friend option but listed and promoted as multiplayer.
Last note: i have been following the game for years, it seems no progress was made to it, there is a screen that has "Coming Soon"
The devs also messed up the release price so i bought for 29 euros and 1 hour later it became 27 euros. With 2 euros i got have bought food for the stray cats near my apartment...

author: {'steamid': '76561198070709807', 'num_games_owned': 1138, 'num_reviews': 460, 'playtime_forever': 1085, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1695499603}
review:
[code]Written By Hidden Gems Review : https://store.steampowered.com/curator/38624426/, Follow me! [/code]

Mythforce is a RPG/Roguelite game.

Finally we have here the definitive game for nostalgia effect, it's a must for kids who grow with cartoons of the 80-90'

For the visual graphics and asthetics of the game it's just superb how can catch the essence of tv shows like he-man.

Beside the nice visuals there is an addictive gameplay pretty simple with only 3 skills each character which can be evolve but the roleplay of each job it's pretty unic feels the dungeon crawler like dungeons and dragons.

The Roguelite part it's pretty complicated sinces you can boost several things like weapons trinkets or even constelations using some kind of runes and gold.

The matchmaking it's the unic thing I don't like, there are no rooms for each stage, it's randomly added to your stage of your party at least that you have friends for invite, you can't select go with random players to determinated stage, the quickplay button send you to a random stage with random players.

author: {'steamid': '76561197976850638', 'num_games_owned': 1117, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1696280641}
review:
MythForce tiene un aspecto impresionante y encapsula a la perfección el aspecto y la sensación de los dibujos animados de acción de los 80. Por desgracia, su repetitivo bucle de juego, su frustrante mecánica de resistencia y su sistema de progresión poco gratificante estropean lo que podría haber sido un juego excepcional.


Hay un tesoro de potencial aquí y creo que Beamdog tiene el talento para hacer que el juego brille, pero MythForce aún no parece un lanzamiento completo. Deseo desesperadamente que MyhForce me encante, y tengo la esperanza de que las futuras actualizaciones subsanen sus defectos.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993407356', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 143, 'playtime_forever': 715, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 82, 'last_played': 1703640176}
review:
This game has a great iconic 80s cartoon feel and I really appreciate the artistic merits behind it. Unfortunately, this final release version of the game actually feels like a demo, where you spend 15-20 mins killing skeletons in what looks like it's supposed to be dynamic randomized dungeons, but the select of "random" dungeons is like 3-4 level configurations left unchanged. You can even go through the same level over and over with absolutely no changes because there's so few levels for it to "randomize", lol. After you grind skeletons, you get to move to the mushroom people for another 15-20 mins, and rinse repeat. This is like, Atari 2600 level design, and so in that sense I guess you could say it's a stylistic choice? 

If this game was being sold for 15$ I think the shallow gameplay and lack of level variety would be more justified. But at the current price, this is not a good look for a demo version equivalent.

Also, as many others have said, get this Epic Games multi-platform dependency out of the game. Figure out how to use the platform you're selling the game on.

It's really a shame the lack of gameplay is so severe, as the voice acting and interactions and art and everything about the game is good. But where is the actual game? This is just a game concept.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971332386', 'num_games_owned': 388, 'num_reviews': 194, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1694545398}
review: Boots through Epic Games Store.
developer_response:
Please note this is not true. The game doesn't require you to install the EGS launcher. It doesn't boot through Epic. It needs to install Epic Online Services that are needed for us to provide cloud saving, matchmaking etc.

Many well-known games use EOS such as Hades and Risk of Rain 2, or Disco Elysium.

https://steamdb.info/tech/SDK/EpicOnlineServices/

author: {'steamid': '76561197977197943', 'num_games_owned': 857, 'num_reviews': 223, 'playtime_forever': 549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 232, 'last_played': 1694904282}
review: MEAAAAAAATFOOOOOOORCE

author: {'steamid': '76561198031120102', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1694543212}
review:
Love the style and graphics! Everything else is... well to put it nicely, it needs more time.

First problem, epic service dependency, I do not want to launch a game via one platform, only for it to open another platform and launch it from there, what's next in the future? A nest of platforms just to run a video game?

Second, after finally able to get in the game from the long initialization of epic service, after starting a quickplay game the tutorial were just dumped to me explaining everything at once in the form of GUI highlights, in silence, that tells me that this game does not have a proper tutorial, which means, its not finished.

Third, after I dismissed all of the tutorial slides, I was immediately teamed up with another player and immediately skeletons just appeared and started attacking us, we killed them and more appear, we killed them and more appear, we killed them and... nothing happened? We were wondering around until we found what seem to be a way forward, then skeletons appeared and we killed them, skeletons appeared and you would not guess what happens next! Rinse and repeat for pretty much the whole game.

Only momentary excitement I felt was during the 1 and only mini-boss fight in that mission against the mushroom mage, and even then the tactic between me and the other player was to just gang up on it and spam attack until it's dead. Afterwards, rinse and repeat.

Finally we made it to the last room, there was a dialogue with the antagonist, OK cool let's do this, we thought, nope the guy ran away and leaves his minions to deal with us which we just need to keep killing them for.. 2 minutes straight I think? Which then we opened up the big chest at the end and.. we don't know we just get stuff from it, pulled the lever and the level just ended.

This game just feels unfinished, at certain times I can tell that it has the potential to be fun and engaging especially seeing the potential to mix and match certain perks and upgrades, maybe later on it's more fun going against tougher and smarter enemies that just doesn't waddle to you slowly and swings their weapon at you slowly and gets staggered on every strike. I'll follow the development of the game, still hopeful that this game could become a good game later on, just not at this moment.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012849102', 'num_games_owned': 276, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 16, 'last_played': 1694540718}
review:
Из плюсов:
Отличный визуал, приятная милишная боёвка, в целом интересная классическая для рогалика система прокачки. Спорный момент по динамике игры, ибо это не жёсткий динамический экшен, это скорее размеренный тактикульный с блоками и, чёрт возьми, стаминой (которая, конечно же, постоянно кончается).

И по минусам:
Цена для такого проекта, конечно, кусается. Странная оптимизация. Игра в целом выдаёт нормальный ФПС (хотя, наверное, для своего графена должна выдавать явно выше, ещё и лок в 120), однако выдаёт постоянные микрофризы, что очень неприятно. Стоит отметить слегка однообразные локи, а точнее повторяющиеся. За один прогон по уровню я встретил как минимум 3 из 10 одинаковых комнаты.

По итогу:
В целом проект выглядит довольно интересно, но мне как-то прям не вкатило. Очевидно, должно лучше раскрываться в коопе и к более поздней стадии игры, но пока что сама кор механика не цепляет. Возможно, вернусь в будущем.

Update:
Понизили ценник, это приятно.
Игра не устанавливает EGS лончер, а ставит некий Epic Online Services, видимо, какая-то приблуда для онлайна.
developer_response:
Добрый день! Спасибо за отзыв, однако следует отметить неверную информацию про EGS - игра его не устанавливает. Никакого лаунчера Эпик. Игра устанавливает только Epic Online Services - эта программа необходима для облачных сохранений, матчмейкинга и т.д. 

В Стиме множество игр использует EOS, например, Hades и Risk of Rain 2, или Disco Elysium.

https://steamdb.info/tech/SDK/EpicOnlineServices/

author: {'steamid': '76561198051111763', 'num_games_owned': 169, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1301, 'last_played': 1694834021}
review:
MythForce looks stunning and perfectly encapsulates the look and feel of 80s action cartoons. Unfortunately, its repetitive gameplay loop, frustrating stamina mechanic, and unrewarding progression system spoil what could've been an exceptional game.

There's a treasure chest of potential here and I think Beamdog has the talent to eventually make the game shine, but MythForce doesn't quite feel like a full release yet. I desperately want to love MyhForce, and I'm hopeful that future updates will remedy its flaws
